Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for about a week in October as first-time Los Angeles visitors. Check-in was pretty quick and easy. The FIRST room on a SPG member floor that they gave us was an adjoining room. And I previously had a bad experience with adjoining room where the neighbor was too loud with a family and the noise from kids was so prevalent that I couldn't sleep. So we asked for another room. The next room, on a non-SPG member floor, had a heavy smoke smell and it bothered my wife since she has a very sensitive sense of smell. The THIRD room, on a different non-SPG member floor, had a weird body odor smell. We almost puked when we walked in. So we finally gave up and said that we'll take the first room that was adjoining. The staff member called us about 5 mins later while we were settling in and asked us how everything was. I explained to him what happened and he apologized and said that he'd give us complimentary breakfast vouchers for one day. When the voucher was sent up, he actually gave us breakfast vouchers for our entire stay. That was a nice little touch. Under promise and over deliver. The breakfast buffet spread wasn't all that great. It had everything you'd probably expect except that the food wasn't that great. So we decided to skip breakfast on two of the days and gave the vouchers to ppl we saw checking-in. And just like everyone has previously said, the self-parking lot was not very convenient. it wasn't so much of a problem or an issue but just an annoyance that it's behind the hotel across the street. And a couple of nights, the lot was so full that we had to park almost at the end of the lot. And if you've been to the lot, you KNOW how huge the lot is. The lot isn't specific to the Sheraton. It's a park n ride for anyone and everyone so the LOT IS HUGE. And when you're coming back late at night, the side entrances of the hotel is locked/closed, so you have to walk all the way to the front of the hotel to enter. Yes, it's cheaper than other hotels like the Westin but very inconvenient. As for ppl asking about the airport/airplane noise, yes you can hear it but it's not noticeable unless you actually TRY and listen to it. It's basically sounds like the a/c or the heater just turned on or something to that effect. A few other misc. items... Good: Computer with internet/printer access, free Wifi in the lobby areas, nice lobby renovations, location is very convenient to the airport, close to rental car companies Bad: Bathrooms are dated and dirty Tip: If you're a SPG member, the SPG floor rooms give you free bottled water in the rooms. I noticed it cause I saw 3 different rooms and the 2 non-SPG floor rooms did not have free water bottles. If you really don't mind the inconvenience of parking, the hotel is a decent stay. I'd probably try another hotel the next time just so that i can compare but it's definitely not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: viprjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12 Dec and really enjoyed my stay! Outstanding customer service provided by Dianne and John the Engineer!!! Thanks so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada's Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy M
Reviews.Content: I want to commend a particular staff member ESTELA ESTRADA for her assistance during our breakfast at the Rise 2011 Event. She was extremely helpful and went out of her way serving me and my colleagues. She was cheerful and happy to fill our requests. Thank-you Estela

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business travelers at LAX”
Reviews.Author: cmbtravel1
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel near LAX by far. Service is excellent, as is the food. Rooms are good size and well kept. The only downside is the parking. Self parking is a bit of a walk - and I did not feel comfortable walking that far alone at night. So I had to use valet parking, which was very prompt, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: Even though hotel has had a makeover in lobby the rooms are still very dated and VERY dark. Otherwise it's a conventient airport hotel- leave time for shuttle as it stops at another hotel first one way to airport

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great, now just ok”
Reviews.Author: L2Connelly
Reviews.Content: I stay here a few times per year for work. I wrote a glowing review earlier in the year but I need to update it. I can't believe how the service changed in such a short time. The front desk staff, as well as the gentlemen who bring room service to the rooms are still lovely and so helpful. But whoever answers the phone and takes orders in the kitchen needs to be replaced. I ordered all my meals from room service during my 3 day stay, and every order was messed up and brought to me incorrectly. Every single one!! The amazing room service delivery staff had to run around all weekend to correct the mistakes. I also feel like this hotel hosts so many events and large parties, that it is sometimes overwhelmingly crowded. I often times had to wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator, and then when it showed up, it was completely ful, and I'd have to keep waiting. Overall, it's a good hotel with comfortable beds and a nice staff. But I just don't think they have the resources to accommodate everyone when e hotel is at capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Average Sheraton quality but abysmal self-parking”
Reviews.Author: MikeBOS
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a 1 night stay over a Saturday night. The public areas and room both seemed fairly typical for Sheraton; nice enough, with no real problems. Service was fine though I didn't ask for much. As an SPG Platinum I got a nice upgrade to a corner suite. But if you have a car, the abysmal self-parking situation would eliminate this place for me in the future. There is a third-party parking lot about a 10 minute walk from the lobby, which at most times has only one booth open for exit. During the day, it can take 1/2 hour or more to get out of the lot because of long lines (it is a regular LAX airport parking lot, not just for the hotel) -- when you combine that with the long walk, it pretty much eliminates any advantage you have from being close to the airport. They do offer valet parking for more than double the cost of self parking; if I ever end up here again, there is no question I will spend the extra money and use the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated but was kept up for 2 nights by noise”
Reviews.Author: Alex123London
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviews that this hotel has some great positives. I loved the decor and the contemporary furniture. Front desk and bar staff were excellent, and conceirge helpful. We had a suite room that provided great space for 2 adults and 2 children. But the noise from neighbouring rooms was unbearable. And being an airport hotel people are checking in and out at all times. On the first night we were woken at 4am by the neighbour checking out, to be followed by a maintenance team coming into the room and making noise. I let that slide and put it down to an unfortunate experience, but the second night a couple checked in at 2am and did not stop talking unitl 5am. I dont think they were particularly loud, but it sounded like they were sitting at the end of our bed. The noise just came straight through the connecting door that was right by our bed. To Sheraton's credit i complained at check out and they tried to make good the situation, but i'd rather had 2 nights sleep than a free breakfast! They asked why i didnt complain at night but i didnt feel that they were talking that loudly, Its just that the noise carries. I should also say that there was no noise from the actual airport. So perhaps this is were all the soundproofing went and they just put up cardboard between the rooms. Its a shame as the location for visiting LA is perfect. Close to the beaches, museums, and an easy drive to Beverley Hills and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to stay next to LAX”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical Sheraton. Very large with lots of rooms and caters to the LAX crowd. There are two things that make this hotel worth it: 1) the parking behind the hotel is comparable to Lot C and 2) the free hotel shuttle. The lot is much smaller than Lot C but the same price of $12 per day. The shuttle actually only stops there and the Radisson so it is fairly quick and comes by more often then the Lot C shuttle. Back to the rooms, I agree with some of the other posters that the room wall are fairly thin, but you can't really hear the airplanes so maybe all the construction went into the outer walls.... If you are a SPG member, then it is not that much for a free night and worth it if you have an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before Thanksgiving due to an early flight out. We went to bed before 11pm to be up by 4:30am. WRONG!! Our neighbors came in at 2:30 in the morning and we could hear their entire conversation. We could also hear everyone's conversation that were in the hallway. These people stayed up for an hour talking. OH MY Gosh! The rooms are nice and the staff are nice but the walls are just too thin.Needless to say, it ended up being a very loooong day for us due to no sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and overall Service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgePapalekos
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton LAX a few times a year for business. Its great place to stay for business while in LA. I person that always stands out is Estela Estrada. A great server that always takes cares of our group. Always has a smile in her face and makes sure that everyone has what they need. Thank you for all your hard work Estela!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonDaytripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before catching a flight the following day to Vegas. The hotel has a great bar and really nice pool. $20 taxi journey gets you a nice night out in Marina Del Ray. Courtesy bus to and from the airport was effortless.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to wait for your next fly at the LA airport”
Reviews.Author: patricio s
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room, oversized bed and nice decoration. The breakfast is great. Many different options at hte buffet and gentle and kind personal. Free airport shuttle every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Thaddeus T
Reviews.Content: Estela Estrada was a great server and made sure everything we needed was taken care of. Her exceptional service made dining at the LAX Sheraton Gateway Hotel pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “the bed was comfortable but the rest was utilitarian at best.”
Reviews.Author: WilliamAllen54
Reviews.Content: One doesn't expect an airport hotel to be great. it's there for convenience and location. This one while having a somewhat stylish room also had a television which was too dim (and when I asked about it was told that it was my eyesight - blame the customer!) a bathroom which not only lacked a bath mat but featured plastic cups and bath gel , no shampoo. The "free" wifi was ultimately free but first you had to be charged $11.99 to use it. I waited for 45 minutes for the shuttle at the airport and when I called was unable to speak to a human being. Another thing about the TV was that it paused for 8 seconds between stations while surfing. Not fun. But at least it was clean and soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value.”
Reviews.Author: Melizondo
Reviews.Content: I would not normally choose an airport hotel, but he convenience and value of this one wins he day. Great service, friendly attitude and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: DeAnneCG
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the excellent customer service provided by Diane Cheek and Merlee Pickett. They attended to my every concern and need swiftly, effectively and with a most cheerful attitude. This hotel is lucky to have such impressive employees.

Reviews.Title: “great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: huggy0907
Reviews.Content: loved it as was very nice convenient to lax and reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service today!”
Reviews.Author: 20cef
Reviews.Content: Facilitated a Seminar at the Sheraton Gateway, we have been at this location a fews times in the past weeks. Excellent service by the hotel staff today! Begining with Sean from presentation services. Sean is invaluable to this Hotel. He is courteous, friendly, and efficient. The Food and beverage team included Estela Estreda, Jose Monroy, Robert Carrillo were all so efficient and courteous. The Banquet Captain, Moises Tamayo I have worked with for many years at a different Hotel and ever so pleased to see him here. He is always helpful with everything and anything he goes beyond to meet our group requirements even if he is not in charge of our meeting that day! Another invaluable employee.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Breeze846
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway while visiting my girlfriend for the weekend. It was wonderful. The staff was prompt and courteous. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The bathroom was also in great shape with lots of water pressure for the shower. Overall, a very pleasant stay. I also had a very early departure, and the shuttle bus was a very quick trip back to the terminals at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Gateway November 1 and 8 to bookend our international flight to China. Clean and modern hotel, good room, free shuttle just minutes from the airport. Very convenient for international flights. Attentive staff with good service. Hotel restaurant had a decent steak and salad which tasted wonderful after a week of Chinese!

Reviews.Title: “Good to catch an early flight out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Cobaye27E
Reviews.Content: Standard room, clean and modern. No view whatsoever but it's an Airport Hotel so it is to be expected. Roomy elegant bathroom. The Hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to LAX and that is the reason why we decided to stay there. Indeed the service was flawless even very early in the morning which made our transfer to LAX very easy. On the downside, we ordered room service. The hotel guarantees delivery within 40 mns according to their menu but when we called, they made it very clear that they do not guarantee the delivery and that it's a take it or leave it deal!! Now, fellow travelers, I will save you the hassle by telling you that the food was disgusting anyway.

Reviews.Title: “An average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoffO869
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving from the UK and before flying on to Seattle the following morning. We chose the Sheraton Gateway mainly because of the generally favourable reviews on Tripadvisor - although there are a lot of other hotels also located at LAX. Sadly it was a bit of a disappointment and certainly didn't match our expectations - and I simply fail to see how it can rate as highly in the overall pecking order of hotels at both LAX and more generally in the Los Angeles area. Let's be quite clear - it is simply an average hotel. It does what it says on the tin - nothing really badly but equally nothing that in any way wows you or makes it stand out from the crowd. The building is enormous - but from the outside to the public areas and into the bedrooms it really could do with being brightened up and modernised because it just felt old. The free transfer service was easy to find and took just a few minutes - but there was no direction from the driver on arrival at the hotel. He'd obviously done his bit - we were just sort of dumped along the entry road leading to the main door. Once inside the hotel the reception area was easy to find - although there were various barriers and signs regarding priority and this didn't make for an especially welcoming experience. The receptionist was friendly enough and got the job done - but where was the genuine warmth and personality or indeed any explanation of the hotel facilities? The best we got was the direction of the lift - and it was only after I asked about the included breakfast that some vouchers were forthcoming. Once in the room we were again left wondering if we had chosen well. Sure it was large and featured all the items you would expect - but the lighting was quite poor making it somewhat dark and it didn't smell that fresh either. The beds were comfortable and we slept reasonably well - but aircraft noise is audible. Breakfast was probably the high point of our stay since the self-help buffet was both extensive and of good quality. Once again though the staff seemed to be largely going through the motions rather than actually enjoying their work - there was little in the way of smiling faces or genuine warmth and we left without anyone noticing. Check-out was painless - the bill had been settled by credit card overnight so no need to visit the reception desk. But no opportunity for anyone to show any interest or ask if we had enjoyed our stay either. The transfer back to the airport was largely a repeat of our arrival - queue up on the approach road next to the appropriate sign then board the bus and get dropped off at the correct terminal. So - and the only thing that really matters - would we use this hotel again? Maybe - but probably only if there was no other choice or if we heard that it had had a bit of a make-over.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST Airport Hotels around!”
Reviews.Author: F16Pilot
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Gateway LAX exceeds expectations for an airport hotel. Shuttle service is adequately frequent. Staff is friendly and rooms are spacious and well above average for a sheraton airport property. I sometimes opt for this property over the nicer downtown locations.

Reviews.Title: “Average but will do if you're stuck at LAX”
Reviews.Author: carnage99
Reviews.Content: I have a great deal of sympathy for the previous reviewer. I was a recent "victim" of Qantas shutting down its entire operations over last weekend and I was shunted off to the Sheraton. By the time I got to my room (5.30am NY time, which is where I'd flown from before getting offloaded by Qantas at LAX) I was ready to pass out. Yes, I too was given a dodgy room. It had sheets and towels everywhere and had clearly not been made up. No apology given by check in staff. I just got given another room. Having said this, I think the hotel is completely fine. It was safe and well located near the airport. It is a good 3.5 star hotel. The staff seem friendly enough. No mini bar but a Starbucks downstairs. The bar and bistro were fine. They have about six computers with free internet in the lobby. I'd look them up again if I was stuck at LAX as it is very good value for money but I wouldn't book this if I was on business or on a holiday in LA.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Experience I Have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela H
Reviews.Content: ...and this is coming from a hospitality major who has interned at hotels and also happens to be a member of Starwood Preferred Guest. HORRIBLE SERVICE. NIGHT SHIFT EMPLOYEES HAD BAD ATTITUDE, NO HINT OF "HOSPITALITY" IN THEIR BONES, AND DID NOT KNOW WHAT THEY WERE DOING. I finally arrived at LAX airport after an agonizing journey that involved me missing my flight and my midterm the next morning. My flight was in 8 hours and after the horrible time I had just been through all I wanted to do was get a hotel room and get 4 hours of sleep. I was so distressed at the time that when I arrived at Starwood at 12 30am I was actually in tears, only to find that I had arrived at the wrong Sheraton and not Four Points (Gateway is more expensive and high-end). When I got to the counter and asked for the rate for 4 hours, the guest service agent looked down at me (I was still teary-eyed) and said in the most demeaning, least compassionate tone, "It doesn't matter if you just stay for 4 hours or a whole day. 220." After thinking it over for around 10 minutes I was so upset that I decided that I needed the room and came back. But the two agents had already gone back into the room behind the counter and I had to wait another 10 minutes until they finally reappeared. Thankfully one of them had a little more humanity and seeing me puffy eyes and in tears at 1am, lowered the room rate to 180 + tax after a series of prying questions regarding my horrible night. I was so ready to head to my room and just pass out at that point, but when I got to my room and swiped my key (which was VERY far from the elevators and 7 or 9 floors up considering my time constraint) THE ROOM DOOR WAS BOLTED. An OLD MAN proceeded to come to the door in a BATHROB and informed me that it was HIS room, and that I must have made a mistake. Exhausted and even more upset at this point, I went ALL THE WAY back down to the counter, where only ONE of the guest service agents had reappeared this time. He was helping another guest check in, but even though he clearly realized that I had a problem (because I had returned after less than 10 minutes), and had little time left to spare, he avoided making eye contact or summoning his coworker until he was done helping the couple (-~10 more minutes of my life). FINALLY I got a new room key to my new room, and when I finally got into the door, despite flicking the light switch in both directions multiple times, THERE WAS NO LIGHT IN MY ROOM. I looked around for the cardholder to put in my keycard (because sometimes you need to plug in the card for the electricity to work), but no, the lights were just not working in my room. I was almost headed back down when exhausted and defeated as I felt, I walked straight into the dark room and tried switching on an individual lamp, which thankfully managed to turn on. I had a horrible night to begin with, but the inept and lack of service and the poor attitude of the Sheraton Gateway staff made my experience so much more exhaustive and awful than it had to be. Ironic that employees working in the HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY do not seem to know the first thing about being hospitable and are incapable of showing any form of sympathy (instead displaying downright rudeness) to a guest who clearly had been through a rough day. Don't even get me started on the filthy bathrooms... But needless to say I will never be coming back to Sheraton Gateway again. My trust in the Sheraton brand has been irrevocably destroyed.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Service”
Reviews.Author: Seionara K
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the outstanding service of Estela Estrada who is a waitress at a function held at the hotel in one of the ballrooms on November 1, 2011. She was really great and very professional in meeting the needs of the participants. She was very sweet and her personality was great! The food was very delicious and balanced. Keep up the great performance Estela!

Reviews.Title: “Underated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I did not expect very much from a category 2 airport hotel. However, was pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent and the ambiance was relaxing. As an SPG member, they provided me excellent service and upgraded me to a junior suite without asking. The fitness room was probably equivalent to a category 4 or even 5 hotel amenity. I noticed that every time I looked around there was a staff member working or cleaning. I will give my hats off to management. Great job and keep up the good work. I would say that if the executive lounge had better food, I would probably have no choice but to give it 5 stars tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option at LAX for SPG Members”
Reviews.Author: DragonFund
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, more soul then the Westin LAX which I tried. Seems to have more to offer guests and better, longer established facilities... SPG benefits better at the Sheraton - large room / junior suite, reasonable executive lounge, breakfast. ...

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne E
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway staff was very courteous, helpful, and competent. One worker in particular offered exemplary service, and I got her name: Estela Estrada. She helped with the meals at our conference, and her attentive service was memorable enough for me to write this review as a kind of "thank you." Her kind, quality performance is one of the reasons I enjoyed my time at the Sheraton Gateway.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location. Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: + Gr8 location Close to LAX Free shuttle bus Friendly staff (bar) - Unfriendly staff (Front Desk)

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M
Reviews.Content: Not only was my room great, it was spotless. Most importantly, I had to finish preparing for a presentation so I requested a late checkout- the woman at the desk (Diane Cheek I think she said her name was), let me stay for 3+ additional hours. This was crucial. Thank you Diane, and thank you Sheraton Gateway. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada”
Reviews.Author: Darrah B
Reviews.Content: Delicious meals, warm and friendly service, and good accommodations. During my recent conference at the Sheraton Gateway, Estela Estrada made sure that my every need was attended to promptly. She greeted us every day with a smile and worked to make sure all of the attendees were satisfied. The hotel's food and beverage department should commend their staff on wonderful selection, great staff, and great service! Who would have thought that an airport hotel would be so fantastic?

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad airport hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: roya_7
Reviews.Content: For a big hotel close to LAX, the hotel offers the traveler a fairly good option. The food varied from mediocre in the restaurant with little to offer vegetarians, to pretty poor in the bar and to spectacular for a Mexican lunch in the meeting room ballroom. Rooms are standard SHeraton rooms, fairly large and choice of runway view or pool and parking lot view but then, this is LAX. The major problem is lack of transport options to points of interest and even to restaurants nearby. This is not an area known for fine dining!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for transit”
Reviews.Author: PuaSai
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th floor and was quiet. Room wasn't bad and the bed was comfortable. The room we stayed in was a no smoking room and there is a card on the desk that states if you smoke in the room there will be a $200.00 cleaning charge billed to you. The bathroom was my pet peeve. Sloooooow draining shower / tub drain which bugged me. I don't like to stand in water backing up from the drain. I was surprised by this because I have stayed in hotels outside the U.S. and never experienced that problem. Thought the room was kind of pricey, but you are close to the airport. Flying planes did not bother us which may have been because we just came off a 14 hour flight. Has restaurants on the property which were ok, but again pricey. Best value for breakfast is the buffet, all you can eat which is rounded to $20.00 / person. The food was good and the service was also. The airport shuttle runs frequently and is free. Internet is like $12.00 USD a day (24 hours) and keeps billing until you check out. They have two bottles of water in the room that you can drink; for $3.00 a pop each. Big screen TV with cable and pay programs on it in the room. If you use the telephone....$1.50 for 800 number calls and $2.00 for a local call. We ordered Thai food from a restaurant a mile away and had to call from the room. I don't like being nickeled and dimed by places and thats what this feels like. Seems to be the norm in the States yet again; right up there with airlines now used to charging people for baggage and inflight movies and food and headphone rentals. All in all it was ok, but I might try another hotel if passing through LAX again.

Reviews.Title: “I've fallen in love with Sheraton all over again...”
Reviews.Author: yobigjoe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Sheraton hotels recently and I must admit that they been sub-par or average at best. I noticed online that the Gateway had been recently remodeled and had mostly good reviews so I decided to give Sheraton one more try. I'm so glad I did! This was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. EVERYONE I encountered was friendly and accommodating, the bed was super comfortable and I loved the gym, pool and hot tub. Hats off to the entire management team and staff members for a well deserved 5-star review. I spent 4 nights there and didn't want to leave. In this review I'm going to address some of the things others brought up here on TA so hopefully you can make an informed decision. There is a free airport shuttle that runs every 15 minutes making it fast and easy to get to/from the hotel. If you have a car, the hotel promotes valet parking. For self parking, drive into the hotel entrance and head straight back past 98th street and you'll dead end to a privately-owned airport parking lot. They allow Sheraton guests to park there for about $14 a night. You will need to pre-pay and then will get in and out privileges during your entire stay. Warning, the lot fills up on weekends (I arrived on Wednesday so had no problem). I noticed they were turning folks away on Friday/Saturday. There is 2-hour street parking on 98th but you'll get a ticket if exceed the two hour limit so be warned. Valet is expensive -- I think around $24 a night -- about $10 more than self-parking. There may be other parking options nearby but you would need to check with hotel staff. I arrived at 1:30 pm and being an SPG Gold Member was hoping I could get an early check-in and a complimentary room upgrade. In my recent stays at Starwood properties Gold members don't get decent upgrades so I was pleased that the Gateway recognized my status and upgraded me to the Club Floor (Top Floor, 15th - with Key Access only). I was able to check into my room early but immediately noticed that the air conditioning was making a funny dripping noise (which was pretty annoying). I called the front desk and they sent an engineer up. At first he said I would need to change rooms but he was able to fix the problem after all. I received a follow-up call to see if I wanted to change rooms and I declined. Great service, no problem. The club lounge was really nice, very large and had a great view of the LAX runway. The lounge has a good selection of fruit, cereal, bagels and juice for breakfast as well as complimentary snacks for dinner. Beer and wine can be purchased from 4-8 pm for a nominal fee. During the day you have access to the lounge where you can work, watch TV, read the paper or get an espresso. A computer/printer is also available for use at no charge. I was able to print my boarding pass there. The lobby/entrance of the hotel is really nice and features free WI-Fi. Lots of people were hanging out in the lobby with friends, work colleagues or on their computer sipping a glass of wine. Very fun vibe. It has a W feel to it without the annoying drunk/party crowd. For me, the highlight of the hotel was the gym and pool/hot tub. The gym is big and has a great selection of modern equipment. As for the pool, it was like I had it all to myself. It's also open really late which is a big plus! The pool area has comfy lounge chairs, large daybeds, FREE heated cabanas (great for socializing at night) -- the space is very relaxing and well thought out. My only complaint for the pool area is that smokers hang out there and blow smoke all over you. I wish they didn't allow smoking in the pool area. The rooms are nice, updated and have great beds. Housekeeping was really friendly and did a great job servicing my room. I only wish there was a safe, fridge and iPod connector in the room. The bathroom was small and a bit dated but functional. I too experienced problems with drainage in the bathtub (as others here have mentioned). The walls are pretty thin and the first night I got awoken at 4 am by some really loud folks in the room next to me. It was really annoying but they must have checked out as the next 3 nights were really quiet. I love that fact that the room was totally dark with the curtains closed. Pitch black... great for sleeping. We had an amazing dinner Saturday night at the hotel's restaurant called Paparazzi. It's unique Italian food with a twist. With the tip and a bottle of wine, it came to $190 for 3 of us so it was pretty pricy but the atmosphere and food quality was great. Our server was also very efficient and friendly. He explained several dishes to us and how they were prepared. Be sure and get the artichokes as an appetizer. Amazing presentation! I wish all Sheraton hotels were like the Gateway. I will now look for Sheraton hotels that have been recently remodeled. Many of the older Sheraton hotels are in pretty bad shape. They did a fantastic job with the remodel on the Gateway and I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. The service and friendliness of the staff really stood out for me. Congrats on a fantastic job Gateway... I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent banquet service”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Sheraton Gateway for a conference - eaten every meal at the hotel for 4 days including 5 where 600+ people were served. Consistently fine food, beautiful presentation, and excellent service. My special thanks to Estela Estrada and her associates!

Reviews.Title: “conference catering”
Reviews.Author: ukedoc
Reviews.Content: was there for a meeting on Oct 15 and Estella Estrada was fabulous! She anticipated our needs, and if we ever had to ask for anything, we only had to ask once. great service!

Reviews.Title: “Catering”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: This is a review on the Catering Service during an event held at the Sheraton Gateway on Oct 20th, 2011. - Food was excellent (Fish, Beef , Chicken and Vegetable Meals) - Service was Excellent (Thanks to Gabrial, Sandra, Maria C., Teo, Alphonso, Miguel V., Miguel L. and Billy.) The Food Service was quick and appropiate for the event. - The Room setup was timely and very organized. - The Chef was able to adjust quantities based on the number of attendees. - The Valet service was quick and efficient. Looking forward to another event with this Sheraton staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel preaty big i just was a little desapointed because notting is included in the rate the internet is extra there was no complementary water etc everything had a charge, and to be honest I stayed in the four points that is from the same chain and it was much better

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EquineDoc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. It was nice and clean and quiet. Excellent proximity to LAX, without the noise that is sometimes experienced at airport hotels. Fabulous wine and cheese party for guests the evening that I was there. Only problem: only valet parking was available and I hate valet. I parked off site, which was a bit of a pain

Reviews.Title: “Nice AP hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrwheels
Reviews.Content: Good location. Easy shuttle to AP. Nicely updated. Has a Starbucks in lobby! Easy to get to downtown. Ample of self parking across the street to avoid hefty valet fees. Restaurant in hotel over priced and food less than par. $25 for a dried up fried pork chop. Leave the hotel and eat else where. A bit noisy being by the AP. Window insulation is ok but you hear a constant muffled roar of planes taking off. May be an issue if you are not a deep sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slchhonor
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently completed our third stay at this hotel. It is our hotel of choice when we stay in the Los Angeles area. The rooms, particularly the Guest Suite, are spacious, well appointed and well maintained. Although it is located right next to LAX, airplane noise was never a problem. We enjoy this hotel because it is conveniently located, is easily accessible, the rooms are nice, but most of all, we like it because the staff is so accomodating. We especially would like to compliment Whitney Johnson , Ysenia (sp?) and Stephen Dycus for making our stay so enjoyable. I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member, but when in LA, I choose to stay at this hotel. Their customer service is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Good overnighter”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOPoole
Reviews.Content: Hotel very close to Lax airport and therefore very useful if arriving very early or very late. Huge hotel and a " Bed factory" really but good overall service. Rooms modern and clean. Staff friendly. Bar quite expensive but breakfast first class. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “LA VA Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Aleshia H
Reviews.Content: My experience was great! Rooms were clean, check-in was a breeze and most of all, their customer service. I'd like to add; Diana Cheek was fantastic and professionalism, she went the extra mile in outstanding support (answered my questions with poise). Great job Diana!!!!! Me and staff will continue to book our overnight or couple night stay at the beautiful Sheraton Gateway Hotel. Thanks to all :) !! Aleshia

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: djhdcj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at the Sheraton Gateway whenever we fly into Los Angeles and we are flying further in the US. It gives us a chance to relax after the long flight across the Pacific and get acclimatised. The hotel is modern and well appointed and has recently been renovated. The rooms are clean, the beds and furniture comfortable and the service is good. The basserie provides continental or buffet breakfast and lunch. There is an Italian style restaurant on the premises for an evening meal. The Starbucks is open all day but closes at 5:00. The staff are accomodating about early check-in and late check-out. There is some aircraft noise but it is nothing in the overall scheme of things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, Most wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: EdmTravellers
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful in helping us through a most difficult situation. My purse was stolen with our passports, identification cards, credit cards, and money in it before we arrived. The hotel was so helpful, and kind in assisting us in many ways. All the staff were great but very noteworthy was the assistant manager Stephen Dycus and Heidi Shiwoku on the Club floor. They were outstanding!! The shuttle left every 15 minutes for the airport and had access to a trolley which had on / off access to a number of sights and the beach which was fantastic It was the best stay we have had anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Personal service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property -- great gym, beautiful pool. I was pleasantly surprised, for something so close to LAX. This is my second time here, and I would have said the service was OK, not great, until just now when Diane Cheek really helped me out. Some of the staff here really know what service is all about. I'll look forward to coming back here in December.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Again!!”
Reviews.Author: JRA_11
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews of hotels, but under the circumstances felt like I had to let others know. Checking into the hotel was a nightmare, after travelling all day, and having a reservation we arrived to find that they didn't have a room for us. Had to stand @ the front desk for over half an hour. Almost felt like leaving but the room was already paid for, so opted to wait it out. After finally getting up to the room, it felt like a "rent by the hour" place. Room smelt like perfume and seemed to have just been quickly cleaned. There was a disgusting stain on the pillow on the bed, so quickly changed pillows before retiring for the night. No fridge or microwave. Room service was expensive. The only reason we stayed here was because it was close to the LAX, but for the price of the room, I will never return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: tothegypsy
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Sheraton Gateway, and I was quite impressed, especially considering this is an airport hotel! The shuttle is quick and prompt, but it was completely jam packed with passengers and one brusque driver. Check-in was quick and efficient, and the lobby area is spacious and attractive. The hallways leading to the rooms had me a bit concerned as they didn't quite appear to be as recently renovated as the lobby. But, once I got in the room, all fears were squashed - the room was spacious, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable. The blackout drapes did the job, and there was essentially no noise from outside or the hallway. The only odd thing - I didn't see a clock in the room! I did check out the lounge, and the Sauvignon Blanc was quite good, too!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: russr
Reviews.Content: Checked in less than 60 seconds - always a good sign! Was pleasantly surprised with the condition of the room given that airport hotels aren't always very good. Needed to take the shuttle at 445 AM and only had to wait about 5 minutes. Took about 10 minutes to get my terminal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stiev a
Reviews.Content: great airport sheraton hotel ,very modern ,great restaurant and great food. nice gym . new rooms with comfortable bed. hotel shuttle good and quick. hotel with good price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: 1smallworld1
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I have grown accustomed to those little things hotels do for you when you are staying at the property. For example, when you forget your tooth paste you can always count on the front desk to have it ready for you. Apparently not at this property. The reason they "ran out" of tooth paste, as I found out later in the conversation was because they were selling it for an inflated price of over 5 dollars or just about 500% of what you would get anywhere else. Also, the food in the restaurant is terrible and over priced as well. Oh, did I mention that they are charging $12.95 for wifi access and more than $20 for parking. So please be ready to be nickled and dimed at this property and all for terrible service too.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service”
Reviews.Author: buddystella
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful; but the bathroom was dated. Service was outstanding. The pool was a little small but very clean. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but the time that we were there was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A brief Stopover.”
Reviews.Author: TomLynnMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights late September 2011 in room 454. Nice room, roomy bathroom. Very good food, bistro breakfast. On site restaurant. About the only criticism was that sound from the next room travelled really well, allow us to easily hear the person in the next room on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for LAX”
Reviews.Author: theredcentre
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed in close to the airport. Modern and updated, rooms very comfortable and bed was great. Front desk made a room available when I wanted to check in at 8.00am with two children, even though he said their were no rooms, he did find one and i was very grateful. Hotel shuttle was good and quick. BUT the hotel buffet breakfast was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT customer service”
Reviews.Author: halfmoonjr
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very nice when we got to the hotel to check in. It was me and my friend that was going to stay at the hotel. We called ahead to make sure that we had our reservation was in but the front desk agent that we talked to said there were no reservation so we just went to see what will happen. When we got there, MUSTAFA & EDDIE @ the front desk took care of us when we brought the reservation paper. They apologize about the problem and they gave us complimentary parking and made sure that we were satisfied while we were there for our stay. That is why this place a great place to stay if I have my family or friends to go there. Donjie Custodio / Melissa Hernandez check-in 09/18/11 check-out 09/19/11 room #370

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a very good price in LA”
Reviews.Author: Catherine C
Reviews.Content: Easy to find. Good price. Pleasant room. Did not hear the airport at all. Good room service. Have to valet park is the only slight negative, but they were very fast at getting the car. It was always waiting for us by the time we got to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Pylot135
Reviews.Content: When I go in & out of LAX I stay here. The rooms are clean & quiet, beds are comfortable & Staff is friendly. The shuttle is 24 hrs every 15 minutes. The only downside is the $21 breakfast...Really?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay in A Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Karma203
Reviews.Content: I had checked in for one night in the Sheraton Gateway LAX. The check in took very long--even though I am SPG Gold. The room was clean and comfortable. Pool did not look to well maintained and the restaurant was overpriced and disappointing. Clerk forgot to give me the Lounge access which I am entitled to as a SPG Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to LAX.”
Reviews.Author: KapitanJ
Reviews.Content: Great location. Standard hotel rooms. Something fun to do is walk over to the In and Out Burger off the end of the runways at LAX. You can sit and have a great burger while jets fly right over (and I mean, right over) your heads. Also a Trader Joe's within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: happylifeYVR
Reviews.Content: We booked club level room with access to the club lounge, free internet access, bottle water, banana, apples and breakfast. A desk with PC/printer, sofa, Flat TV and three major newspapers. The lounge also provide afternoon appetizer, have a bottle beer or cup of wine, and enjoy the view to the LAX Airport if you love to watch the scenes of aircraft landing. The woman who works in the club lounge has no smile on her face, but the gentleman is good, practice his language talent with us. Our room faces to the LAX airport as well, but cannot take picture over the window, as it was dirty outside. Room is clean and has a good size for 4 people, it is quiet on the top floor, but you can hear toilet flushing if someone stay as your neighbor. My kids enjoy the clean and warm water pool and fitness center a lot. Valet parking is convenient but a little pricy ($28 per night). There are two parking company behind this hotel with half price, if you are on budget, go for that. As we have kids, we prefer the valet parking, hassle free, save time on looking for parking spot. Budget car rental locates one block from this hotel. On site Starbuck has lots of choice, if you stay longer than 1 day in the hotel, participate the go green program when you check-in, you will receive reward of a $5 coupon for use at this Starbuck, it is expired prior to check-out. Free PC/printer provided at lobby for you to print boarding pass. The Bar cocktail lounge in the lobby has big screen on the wall; we had good time to watch the Michael Jacksonâ€™s performance. Customer service is very good, despite our room phone was no working after we checked-in, which was very frustrated after I tried few calls to front desk and value parking, it went to nowhere. I went out the room and found a lady who was doing housekeeping, she was so nice and allowed me to use phone in the room beside us that was not working either. She called someone also called maintenance person coming to check, and it finally works before the maintenance came inâ€¦ Then my hubby went to the lounge to try WIFI, it not works on our iPad, so I called front desk again, they provided us free internet access in our roomâ€¦ Later we also received follow-up call from front desk to double check if everything works, and they offer us points for those inconveniences. Overall, we had a great stay at Sheraton Gateway LAX, thumbs up to the customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway a great place for a conference.”
Reviews.Author: Arleighk
Reviews.Content: I recently put on a conference for local teachers at the Sheraton Gateway LAX. We had around 48 participants. The food and service was excellent as well as the rooms. The staff was excellent and the prices were the best! I would recommend this hotel for your conference. Special thanks to Estela Estrada for her excellent service and help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Our Company had a scheduled event at the Sheraton Gateway in Los Angeles, Ca. this week. The service level was exceptional especialy one of the staff members that was very attentive to every need she went above and beyond our expectation Estela Estrade thank you for your service and we plan to continue our events here in the future. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travelling in and out of LAX”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccallama
Reviews.Content: We were arriving in LA after 18 hours of travelling, and wanted to stay in a hotel which was clean, quiet and with a comfortable bed so that we could get some sleep before starting our journey up the coast to San Francisco. The shuttle from the aiport was really convenient, the check in was quick and easy, and the rooms were lovely with heavenly beds. We also booked for the night before we were due to fly back to the UK, and spent some time in the pool and hottub before we flew. We didn't use the gym but it looked great, and made us wish we had brought our gym kiit with us so that we could have used it. Great Sheraton,with all the amenities required for a business traveller, or a weary tourist looking for an easy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient. Nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: rosielovestravel
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't stay long, it was a great pit stop. The beds were comfortable. The hotel lobby is under construction, but it didn't get in the way of our stay. The shuttle to the terminals took a while to show up which was frustrating since we could have practically walked to our terminal by the time the shuttle got us there. It is almost the very last hotel before you enter the LAX terminals, so you really can't beat the location to catch a flight. There was nothing extraordinary about the rooms. The decor was nicely updated. The only complaint was that the room had a musty, body-odor smell that lingered from past guests. It would benefit the hotel to steam clean the furniture or carpets or even put an air filtration unit in the room to freshen the air. The windows don't open, so if there is no fan in the room, what can you do? We ate in the bar restaurant in the lobby. The food was good - loved the french onion soup. Pricey as it was, it was nice to have good food available considering the only restaurants within walking distance are Subway and Burger King.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient for travelers departing from LAX. I was not flying out of LAX next morning however noticed that the hotel has a 24 hour shuttle service to and from the airport (it is located within 5 minutes from the hotel). Noticed the walls are thin. I could hear people talking in the hallway, opening doors, walking, etc. and this is with my door closed. There is free wi-fi in the lobby. To use wi-fi in the room there is a fee of 10.95 per 24 hours. However if you have a feature call wi-fi on your cellphone you could use your cell phone as a server/modem and get free wi-fi in your room. I got this hotel through priceline for 117.00 a night including taxes and fees. Be aware that this hotel is being rated as a 4 star with priceline. In other websites the Sheraton is being classified as a 3 star hotel. For this price I could have a successfully bided for a hotel that reflected more accurately a four star status, such as the continental, marriot, etc. This sentiment was reafirmed at check-in when the clerk told me this hotel had been downgraded to a 3 star. At this point it was time to ask for extra perks, it never hurts to ask. I told the clerk to give me an upgrade from the room I was checking in. I was given an upgrade, however I cannot honestly say with certainly if I was getting an upgrade or not because I have no basis to compare with. I also asked for free buffet breakfast valued at 14.95 per person. At first the clerk said the breakfast was not included with my rate, however before surrendering the room keys he took out two vouchers good for free breakfast buffet which added a nice touch to my stay. I will not hesitate to stay here again, however I would not go through priceline again. Not to for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Expectations were not met.”
Reviews.Author: letsoh
Reviews.Content: For a LA hotel my expectations were high. I have stayed at better hotels in less expensive cities. The phone did not work and the faucet was loose. Though the shower provided plenty of hot water and the bed was comfortable, I was kind of let down. Additionally the meal from the bar was good and good portion size but it was so expensive $16 for a sandwich. A food pantry would have been a better offer.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating Staff, Convienient, Clean.”
Reviews.Author: 18spoons
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in LA for business I stay at the Gateway. It's a comfortable, convenient hotel. I attended a meeting there for work and Estela Estrada was super accommodating. Sometimes the prices are a bit much when it's busy, but I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Restaurant limited but room service more options”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: Very nice looking/modern hotel. Concierge is great and knowledgeable. FULL SERVICE Starbucks in lobby that you can charge to your room. Nice modern business center. They have an Italian restaurant called Paparazzi which is very cool and plays on the name. Walls full of pics taken by a local guy with a story to tell with each picture. Very cool bar and lounge room for drinks. I LOVE Italian food and found their menu very limiting and foo-foo shi-shi. Where was the plain shrimp alfredo. None. Not even a dish with alfredo or cream sauce. Everything had too much something extra in it - mushrooms when I didn't want any, asparagus if I didn't want it, etc. And it was hard to read the menu - just give me plain english please. I ended up having a pizza from them (good pizza). One night I did order room service (stuck working and without a car) and the food was delicious! The menu had more selections. You can hear the airplanes take off but it wasn't disturbing. Also an EXCELLENT rate. $135 pre-pay (wireless in room is extra). It was prepaid because I was sent there for work and it was pretty much a guarantee I was going. Very surprised at the price. Excellent value! No fridge or microwave in room but I absolutely would stay there again. Getting around with no car? Have them get you a cab instead of taking a car service if you're only going a few blocks (CVS, supermarket, bank, Kohls, nail salon, strip malls, etc). You should be able to catch a taxi back or call a taxi company to pick you up to take you back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: i was so very pleased with the attentiveness and wonderful service rendered by Estela Estrada. She was very accommodating and conscientious. We are looking forward to further interaction and meetings scheduled at the Sheraton Gateway. Wonderful staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking???”
Reviews.Author: Nioe978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton LAX last night. The hotel is non-smoking, or so they say. I went through 4 rooms to find one that didn't smell strongly of smoke. It still smelt a little. Some of the corridors also smelt of smoke. I asked the staff if this was a common problem. In separate converstaionso, one said it happens sometimes and the other said quite a lot. She blamed it on the high number of international travellers that stay there and are used to smoking in their home country or just ignore the rules.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: AJP57
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this property. It's so close to LAX, you can almost walk there, if there were sidewalks. Solidly good property, personable and welcoming staff, free Internet access in the lobby with a good number of pcs, free airport shuttle service and good breakfast buffet at a reasonable price. Comfortable rooms with the typical great Sheraton beds. At least during my stay, this is a very busy property. Great soundproofing because I heard no airplane noise during my stay on the 3rd floor. Public transportation is close by but it's slow which is the southern California way. Santa Monica is close by for shopping and dining and you can take one public bus there. Mustafa at the Front Desk is great!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: JAEBSF
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write a review for this hotel for a long time. I've been staying here routinely for over 20 years. You would never know this hotel is that old. It is one of the best managed and maintained hotels I know of. It is excellent is very respect. The staff are friendly knowledgeable and very well trained. The rooms are consistently excellent! The onsite amenities are excellent by the standard of airport hotels. My preferred LAX hotel highly recommended. Book early this is a popular hotel with experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wall thin as paper”
Reviews.Author: Frquntravels
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is excellent. They are helpful and service-oriented. However, be ready for walls that are literally thin as paper. We (including my 1-year old) stayed in a suite on the 8th floor. The room were connected to the rooms on both sides by a door. On both nights that we stayed, we could hear every single word from the people beside us. In fact, we could see their light through the bottom of the door. On the second night, we could even smell the alcohol. They were not particularly loud, but the walls were very thin. Needless to say, my baby could not sleep. Our room were also close to the ice machine. We could hear the loud noise from the machine every single time. Although the staff members tried to help, I personally would not stay here for this reason again.

Reviews.Title: “Good last minute stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: Didn't make my flight at LAX, but got a great online rate at the Sheraton Gateway. Free shuttle to the hotel and easy check in. Comfortable room and good faciitiies. M. Picket helped me sign up for Starwood Preferred Guest and arranged for a day rate so that I could stay in my room until my night flight departed. She was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skybohi
Reviews.Content: Whenever we have to layover in LA we chose the Sheraton Gateway . We like the amenities, the food and the overall service. plus if we book in advance we often can get good rates. The staff are very helpful , friendly and seem happy to be there unlike the Hilton LAX where the staff seem not to be happy to be there and it shows in their lack of service with a smile. This trip the hotel had made a booking error and had charged us for it. On addressing it with the manager he immediately set things right. They have gained our loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada, great service”
Reviews.Author: PedroARivera2
Reviews.Content: I must first begin by thanking Estela for going above and beyond expectations. Her warm smile and friendly attitiude were a welcome sight for a business traveler. Her attention to detail, presentation and the needs of her guest were evident throughout the day. She was truly a pleasure to have met. I would recommend this hotel and it's business services based on this very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference service”
Reviews.Author: Dan K
Reviews.Content: We have done a number of conferences at the Sheraton Gateway and have always come away impressed with the staff, food and service. Thank you Estela Estrada for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Location great if you are on a stopover”
Reviews.Author: auzzigirls
Reviews.Content: We had one night back in LA before flying home so we booked in thinking we wouldn't have a car and it would be easy to get to airport, which it is, but we had a hire car - which we hired through arguscarhire.com.au (and we got a great deal through them - yes I would recommend them) and our reasonably priced accomodation jumped in price dramatically as we had to pay for valet parking (AU$28) per night and we were advised that they did not have self parking, so think carefully before booking as we also had a no refund, no cancellation policy on our booking, (which we booked a month in advance). The hotel is nice and rooms are large and clean. And check your bill as they tried to overcharge us for 2 nights on the valet parking. Off course they apologised and removed the overcharge!

Reviews.Title: “Is this a real Sheraton???”
Reviews.Author: AysenurErdem
Reviews.Content: They charge 30$ for valet parking :) The dark skinned guy at the parking (Ithink he is a manager or smth like that) is very rude. While we were making our check we asked the price of valet parking per day. He told us it is 30$. After the check in we should take our car for self parkig, he told us that it costs 20 usd for 10 minute parking there after our long trip to LA from Turkey :) The woman at the reception was very polite I think she is from Romania. The breakfast was disgusting. The Mexican mam at the restaurant was so rude also. Every morning we had to wait just for our tea for 10 minutes. She acted as if she is not a waitress :) We were very disapointed about this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tth627
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in the door Yolanda greeted us and made us feel welcomed. As well as Diane Cheeks Thank you sooo much for great service

Reviews.Title: “good for business trips”
Reviews.Author: semya
Reviews.Content: very close to airport, top-level service and rooms. not cozy, very far from anything touristic

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A O
Reviews.Content: We do live events at various hotels around LAX almost monthly, and the Sheraton Gateway is not my favorite hotel around LAX to work at, the valets and the front desk are not as helpful as I would like, but Estela Estrada singlehandedly makes it one of my favorites. She should be the director of guest relations, if the rest of the staff had the passion for service that Estela has, then this would without a doubt be the best hotel ever! Azra & Shoni in the catering office are also exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!DIANE PAUL VERLINA YALONDA ARLENE AND CHRISTA”
Reviews.Author: ElondaW
Reviews.Content: I have NEVER experienced this type of customer service before! From the very moment I pulled into the parking lot until the very moment I left. The valet attendants were very attentive and prompt with great customer service. The front desk greeted me a smile from the moment I stepped into the door. If I had to think of one thing that was not to my liking, I would not be able to do so. My visit to LA was due to the passing of one of my family members. With such short notice, I used Starwoords Preferred Guest reward points to book my room. When my points ran out, I relocated to the Radisson next doorâ€¦â€¦BIG mistake. After being spoiled by the Sheraton, there was no comparison. I quickly changed back to the Sheraton...the very next day! With the great customer service and great accommodations, who could ask for more, right? Well, to my very pleasant surprise, the staff at the hotel wrote a handwritten note expressing their condolences in which all of them signed. The fact that a hotel would be so kind as to do such a thing solidified the fact that not matter where I go, I will always stay at the Sheraton. Thanks for a job well done!!!!! I would like to show special recognition to the following employees: DIANE!!!!!! You are the best Paul Verlina Arlene Christa Yalonda Sorry if I misspelled any of the names.

Reviews.Title: “Service isn't so good nowadays”
Reviews.Author: Mcannie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times before & it was great. This time, the hotel facilities were just as nice but where was the service & the friendly staff? They weren't around this time! Sad, it made us try another hotel on the way home instead of returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crbridgeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night after my flight was delayed. Extremely easy check in, rooms were lovely and clean and comfortable. As I was traveling by myself the lovely girl who checked me in gave me complimentary breakfast, which was great! Loads of variety and very friendly service. The bed was extremely comfortable, the only small comment I have was the shower in the bathroom seemed slightly dated and could do with a bit of updating. The water pressure out of the shower was extremely strong and hurt! Perhaps fancier showerheads could be used in stead to make it feel more decadent. Hotel staff were extremely helpful. They gave me information about Manhattan Beach (about 15 mins away from the hotel and worth the trip) and where I could go shopping! Free shuttle to and from the airport was extremely good. Ran slightly behind time but the driver was very helpful with my large bags that I could not lift on my own. I also ordered room service for dinner. Food was excellent (huge portions) and very well priced. Check out was very smooth. Overall a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Meeting Accomodations & Associates Rocked My World.”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I am compelled to provide recognition to Estela Estrada and the Staff of the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles who went the extra mile to ensure attendees of the California Institute of Mental Health / Los Angeles County Department of Mental Health ICSC Harvest Meeting were well cared for and comfortable. Ms. Estrada was friendly, attentive (not intrusive) and is an excellent ambassador for Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Estela Estrada in Banquets”
Reviews.Author: Gayle H
Reviews.Content: Estela Estrada took amazing care of me and my team. She is the most accommodating server I have come across. She is so friendly and kind. She exemplifies what a server should be. I am looking forward to having her service our event at the end of the month. We will be requesting her. Thank you Estela!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Miguel M
Reviews.Content: I was there for a gala and found the service to be great - especially hotel worker, Estela Estrada. She was very helpful and despite all the chaos she always had a smile on her face. Thanks for making an ejoyable moment even better

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located to the airport ... and the car rental”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in general. And great location too. There should be a update on the hotel's website that self parking is off-site. A park'n'fly style parking lot is right at the back of the hotel. Â They charge around $14 per day for hotel guests. Beware that the in-and-out privilege is only till 1pm, even if you checked in at midnight and only parked for half a day. Valet parking is available for $28. Budget rental car is walkable from the hotel (1 block). You might save one night parking by picking up your car next morning after your arrival. The hotel has free shuttle to/from the airport with a stop at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i love hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marksppt
Reviews.Content: hotel has very great service. i will stay here every time i come to Los Angeles. employees are are very nice and helpful. Especially Estera Estrede. she took very well care of us. Theres many hotels in this area but the The Sheraton gate way by lax is my 1st choice. Thanks Again to Estera Estrede she was the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, definately coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Maria L
Reviews.Content: Excellent service employes are respectful and courteous customer service is exeptional great for business meetings

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada of banquet department”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie M
Reviews.Content: Estela Estrada in Banquet department is taking such great care of me and my team. She is extremely polite and helpful. She is a delight to work with and we will request her to work our functions when we return here later this month.

Reviews.Title: “We continue to come back. Love working with Estela Estrada”
Reviews.Author: SWright95866
Reviews.Content: Estela Estrada and the Sheraton Gateway, Los Angeles conference team provided EXCELLENT service for our 2 day meeting. This is our 4th time hosting this meeting at their property. They were fast, friendly, professional, courteous, and accommodating. For an organization that hosts many trainings and conferences, we appreciate this type of service. One of the best things about hosting our trainings at the Gateway Sheraton is working with Estela Estrada. She anticipates your needs and takes care of them with a smile. If you are looking for a great venue for your next event with an award winning team consider the Sheraton Gateway Hotel, Los Angeles. Itâ€™s the experience that keeps us coming back!

Reviews.Title: “totally loved it”
Reviews.Author: stlandmexico
Reviews.Content: The room was great - bed was so comfy. The staff was helpful and wonderful (especially Diane and Alfredo). I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Franj51
Reviews.Content: Also got to deal with Diane during a difficult situation. Was very pleasant, professional and most helpful. Entire desk and management team were great. Will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everytay will be here!”
Reviews.Author: FreddieRay
Reviews.Content: Everything was awesome! Starting with guest services, dining, location, etc! Diane Cheeks really made me feel so comfortable and "right at home!" Thanks a lot.... The room was spacious and the hotel is full of convienences.... Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service. !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cecicox
Reviews.Content: Yolanda (Front Desk) should be commended for her above and beyond customer service skills... She definitely makes you want to stay at the Sheraton Gateway... Thanks for you bubbly attitude and great customer service... Would also like to commend Diane (Guest Relations) I loved her honest interest in making my stay and needs spectacular... Thanks Diane for the person you are....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Assistance”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occassions in the past but I must say that none has been as delightful as this one, thanks to the kind assistance of Diane Cheek. Her witty personna brightened up the gloomiest day I have had in a long time. Not only was her attitude very pleasurable but her assistance with personal issues I was having has turned this trip into a real Labor Day weekend for me and my daughter. Thanks to her I will make sure that the next time I come to stay at this hotel I will leave my worries at home and to expect nothing but the best from the hotel staff,. THANKYOU Diane Cheek

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location to visit LA”
Reviews.Author: HelenaGuerra
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and tasteful decorated. I loved the details as a huge mirror hanged in the wall! We also had Starbucks coffee in our room. Everything was very clean. This location is a little busy and noisy but I had no complains, I slept well. The only issue was the ventilation from the bathroom of the room next to ours that was connected with our bathroom... No coments! 4 stars because it's a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: traveller5678072
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in May after driving back from Yosemite. We had an early flight the next morning. The hotel was clean. We ordered dinner to our room as there were no restaurants open at the hotel. The food was great but we would have rather ate in a restaurant. They have very limited hours at the hotel restaurants. The Starbucks also does not open until 5:30am even though by 5am there are about 30-40 people already up and waiting for the shuttle bus as many flights to the east coast leave before 7am. The hotel had a business atmosphere and I did see a large and crowded bar near the lobby. My wife and I had our 18 month old son with us and he slept on an inflatable toddler bed which fit in the large hotel room (one king size bed). In the morning the airport shuttles came regularly as we saw two come and go while waiting in the lobby for my wife to come down from the room. The shuttles were fairly packed which works out well because if the shuttle is not full it stops at other hotels - if it is full it goes straight to the airport terminals and this makes the trip much faster. Also, you can hear and see planes approaching for landing from the hotel room but this did not bother our sleep and our son loved watching them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay close to airport; staff were extremely accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: 519snow
Reviews.Content: Our family (SPG members) stayed at this hotel the evening we arrived in California, on August 27th, 2011. I had reserved us a room with two Queen beds on the Club floor, but we did not arrive until later in the day (after 9pm), and there were not any of those rooms available at that time. We were offered the option of staying on another floor, with access to the Club floor, but preferred to stay on the Club floor if possible. So, the helpful desk staff offered us a suite on the Club floor, with a King bed and a pullout. We accepted this room, and were very pleased. It was immaculate, and extremely spacious, and was also very quiet (didn't hear any noise from other rooms, doors slamming in the halls, etc). I can't think of one negative about this room. When I had originally booked the room (over the phone), I used a special SPG rate code, which was to allow us to enjoy breakfast downstairs in the restaurant, instead of the continental breakfast on the Club floor. However, when the confirmation email arrived, the reservation agent had used a different code to enter our reservation, and the breakfast was no longer included. We did call the reservation line, but were told that they couldn't help us at that time. So, I decided to ask the front desk staff on Sunday morning if there was any way they could correct the reservation. The computer did show that our reservation had been changed, but they were unable to change it back. However, Yessenia very kindly gave us the breakfast vouchers anyway, and we enjoyed a fabulous breakfast in the restaurant. We will definitely book a stay with this hotel the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: TLTraveller
Reviews.Content: Originally chose the hotel for it had a Starbucks located in the hotel. As well, located a stone throw from LAX. Free shuttle to and from the airport or self parking across the street, or you could valet it. It was also less than 1/2 hr SUNDAY afternoon drive to the Hollywood area. From checking in, staff was very helpful and courteous with my questions they have probably have answered 100X already that day, from checkout times to free WiFi to places to eat. Rooms were clean and very large. I had a nice view of the landing area of the airport so it was kind of cool to see planes take off and land. And the view of the parking lot was also nice if you like that sort of thing. If you are a light sleeper then the roar of the planes might unsettle you or the boom of the hotel doors from people going in & out of their rooms. The hotel had a nice pool to cool down from the California sun. A standard hotel bar and an Italian restaurant. No in room safe, but available ones at reception. My tv remote went on fritz (I think the batteries were dieing), but with WiFi it didn't matter to me. Not to be alarmed, but to connect to the in room WiFi, they charge it to your room, but the charges are reversed in the system automatically. Overall, it was a great lay over stop and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: wacomick
Reviews.Content: Clean full service hotel minutes from airport. Helpful, friendly staff. Only complaint is the charge for wifi in room when the business area offers it for free. Still highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic accommodation - great staff who are very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Louisa24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week as I was attending a conference at the hotel and thought it would be convenient to just pick the one hotel rather than check into a couple - especially after such a long flight from England. The rooms are quite spacious and the cleanliness is to a very high standard - the cleaning staff work very hard! The first room I was given was looking at the runway so I moved rooms and was given one overlooking the pool which was a much better view. They have a policy of rewarding you with $5 per night if you forego the maid service - I only received 3 vouchers in total even though I left the ticket on my door every night and the queue in the morning at the check in desk was always so long I couldn't be bothered to wait and get my voucher. The main thing I would have liked in my room would have been a mini fridge to store my own drinks. The internet was $12.95 for the night - very pricy!! Albert in the concierge was so helpful and friendly - that guy knows everything about LA and the places to check out and nothing is too much trouble. The staff on the check in desk were a little frosty and stiff but very professional and polite. The Starbucks and lobby area makes the hotel feel a bit more luxurious than it actually is, however the pool is always a bonus - there is also a spa jacuzzi but its always busy. If you want a hotel right near the airport to use as a base to explore the rest of the city or for business then this place is fine but if you're looking for something special and romantic then personally I would choose something well away from the airport and near the vast amount of beaches that are a 20-30 min drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Returning Aussie”
Reviews.Author: Doogal01
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel because it's close to LAX and the service & quality over the past six years has not declined. For an airport hotel it's got to be one of the better ones in the sheraton group offering and they don't mind if you check in for half days. Because Sydney bound flights are last to leave LAX at night - this hotel helps you unwind for the long 12 hour trip back to Sydney + the shuttle is free and the bar & internet is always pleasant. An added bonus - the hotel now offers free wi fi - something I was pleased to discover. I look forward to returning in the not to distant future Jo Fredericks Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Diane was great, made my stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl211
