We were very tired, it was 1am, and I asked the manager if maybe he by himself can call united and ask for this voucher. After 20 minutes wait he came to me and said that he is very sorry, but he couldnt reach any one at united. I think that as a service of the hotel he should have offered us a room and try to get his voucher the next day. .......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: KGD'sMOM
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in January, we used the Sheraton inbetween our flights from Toronto to Maui at the beginning and end of our vacation. We really like the sweet sleeper beds and the fact that it is one of the only hotels in the area that has two queen beds was the reason for booking. I kept checking their website and got a rate of $89 for each night. We were upgraded to a suite on the second stay which was nice because we were there longer. Very quiet considering how close to LAX and efficient staff. We ate breakfast at the buffet in the morning and though it was good we paid nearly as much for it as we paid for the room. The shuttle to airport runs on a regular basis and was easy to deal with each time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worked”
Reviews.Author: BeaPants
Reviews.Content: Free valet parking was filled so we had to park a block away and walk or pay. The key card machine was broken so we had no key. The air was faulty. Even after being fixed it was muggy in the room. Loved the beds though.

Reviews.Title: “" A re-LAX-ing airport hotel "”
Reviews.Author: ritchey
Reviews.Content: I was spending Christmas holidays accompanied by the young nephew, travelling around LA and Las Vegas, and was pleased I choose to stay at the Sheraton Gateway hotel near to LAX international airport. I had chosen this airport hotel as our last residence, on what was a fairly busy itinerary. I would be no stranger to Los Angeles while it was the nephews first visit. We had flown back again into LAX from Vegas late evening and it was so convenient to take the hotels courtesy shuttle bus, from the 'Courtesy shuttle bus pick up area' just outside baggage claim. Look for the sign. We had to wait a touch, but when we got picked up, we found ourselves at the hotel in no time at all, so really handy. Basically nearing the end of our holiday, I preferred a nice big hotel with a relaxing atmosphere, a stylish, spacious and comfortable room. I had requested a view towards the main runways, of which I managed to land !! There was not a lot going on in the area and I had expected this, so I wasn't disappointed. Moving away from our hotel, the green Metro lines Aviation / LAX stop is a short bus trip away. "Big blue bus" serves this stop also. Green Metro line links up with others, to cover much of LA city and I feel it is ( probably safe enough ? ), to decide to use, this form of public transport, providing it is not too late on at night. I did not feel too comfortable about some of the places it stops at and areas it passes through. Moving on, and back again to our hotel, theres also a few of them Big Burger type fast food chains not too far away. Our allocated room was modern, it had lots of room, a large screen TV ( convenient for watching the Rose Parade on New Years morning ) a large writing desk, few big comfortable lounging chairs, etc. We were supplied with a Queen size bed each and neither of us seemed to have any trouble falling to sleep. A good nights sleep was assured, even though the hotel is near airport. No concerning issues, I was able to easily check-in for our Long haul direct flights back to London Heathrow, from the hotels facility ( computer was located next to the hotels own Starbucks coffee shop ! ) The concierge folk, I must point out, were very helpfull too. We enjoyed relaxing by the outdoor swimming pool, prior to the hotels courtesy shuttle coach, returning us to LAX, in good time. The pool, jacuzzi, nice surrounding greenery, also made for a relaxing, indeed peacefull, pre-flight environment. I was well pleased that I had chosen to stay at this establishment, prior to the start of our long homeward bound journey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice LAX Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night prior to next day flight, upgraded to suite on 8th floor, had a nice feel to it, kind of like a corner room with bed off to a secluded area and separate seating area. Bathroom was a bit old school and tight where you have to shut to door to use the bowl. It is a shame that these older properties doen't get updated bathrooms because this is all the craze these days! Gym was perfect! Pool looked very inviting as well, didn't need to eat in house as I had access to club lounge, overall this is a nice perperty and I would no doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in LAX area”
Reviews.Author: phl-kc
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to reinforce the great operation and service at Sheraton LAX. I have stayed at the Courtyard, Westin, Raddisson and Embassy Suites near LAX and in my opinion, Sheraton is the best by far. Best qualities are the top-notch fitness room for an airport hotel, nice sized rooms and friendly, efficient service. I'm not pleased with the food and beverage operations (low quality and overpriced) but all in all, I usually have a great experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Overall, the property itself is outstanding, some of the staff not so much. It was a Priceline rate that was outstanding, though, and a definite bargain - even with a slightly shirty/indifferent staff. The parking lot was being rebuilt the day we checked in, and there was a LOT of staff confusion about Plan B. One valet told us to park alongside a curb, then his supervisor curtly directed us to move: Lots of attitude from him. Not the usual quality of Sheraton employee. The desk staff was OK - not warm, but in no way hostile, either. Just efficient and perhaps uninterested in dealing with a Priceline customer. That's sometimes the price of a bargain rate. The upside: Rooms are immaculate, modern and fresh. Quality, plush furnishings. Quiet. Lobby is upscale and new. Outstanding pool, hot tub (under an enormous tree) and sun deck - they work hard to achieve a sort of West Coast/European trendy feel, which is no easy matter in an airport hotel. For some reason you've got to walk past the upscale bar/restaurant to get there - ?? The business travelers in suits end up having parades of sunbathers wander past. Oh well. Location is plenty convenient to the airport. Not an easy location if you're a pedestrian - there's nothing much nearby. But a terrific view of LAX's decorative light poles.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenience for LAX - comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: njoyurkidz
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 young teenagers) stayed as a result of a stopover at LAX. The hotel has great location easy access by shuttle or rental car. Easy to hop on freeways. Room was clean and beds were comfortable. Staff was friendly. Parking the rental car was pricey. Overall, I thought hotel was a decent value for our family and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: whimsicalwarthog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a day lay over in LA coming home from our Mexican vacation. This hotel was fabulous. When we arrived we were exhausted and hungry. Checkin was fast and the rooms were great. The beds were so amazingly comfortable and the linens were as well. From our room we could watch huge jet airplanes land ( the airport is practically across the street) but we could not hear a thing, it was pretty cool Food from room service was delicious but pricey. For coffee lovers there is a Starbucks in the lobby. The hotel is located not to far from Manhattan Beach. You can catch a trolly like bu to the beach and surrouding areas for only three bucks! Great hotel to stay for a day or two!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Comfort at Sheraton Gateway LA”
Reviews.Author: Cornucopia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway twice in December 2009, self, wife, daughter and her boyfriend. We liked the bigger than usual rooms, comfortable beds (best anywhere!), convenience to and shuttle connection to LAX and the free broadband (in the lobby), Having a Starbucks on the premises was a bonus. Also, the valet parking was quick and reliable, if a bit expensive..... We couldn't get the in room broadband to work and the IT Help Desk (external to hotel) was on message, so no help!! So I asked the Desk to refund the four day broadband charge I had committed to and they said they did, after I returned home it appeared on my credit card!! Now they're not answering email!! So nice, comfortable, convenient hotel but a shame about the administration!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an overnight layover at the Sheraton Gateway. We found the hotel to be great for what we needed before continuing on to San Francisco the following day. The staff members at the front counter were friendly enough although I didn't agree with having to pay for short term parking. If we needed it overnight then fair enough but we only needed parking for 4hrs before having to return our rental car. The room was big and very spacious. We used the gym on the ground floor. There were various weight machines and cardio machines. The pool was closed due to maintenance. The main restaurant was closed due to it being a Sunday so we ate at the bar. The food was good and reasonably priced. There was also an endless supply of non alcoholic drinks. In regards to the internet we used the internet on the ground floor which was located next to the bar. It was complementary so I'm not sure why the other review writers were charged. There is a complementary shuttle service to the airport which runs approximately every 20minutes. Because the Sheraton is the last pickup its a direct trip to LAX which takes about 5-10minutes. Overall the Sheraton is a great stopover/layover and I highly recommend it. The only negative I have which doesn't involve the Sheraton is the poor service provided by United Airlines. All I can say is their service in general sux!! I don't recommend as a preferred airline.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhhhhhhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Although there is nothing inherently WRONG with this hotel - I am inclined to agree with the large number of reviewers here who say that the service is lackluster. We only had a very short layover in LA; we arrived at the shuttle stop around 12:30 AM ... it's a shared shuttle with another hotel, and has to stop at every terminal at LAX. As busy as it was, one shuttle should cover Terminals 1,2,3 & TB ... while another gets 4,5,6,7 - by the time our bus got around to United at Terminal 7 - it was too full, and had to turn away passengers. It was unprofessional, and had I beed outside that door, I would have been LIVID. So, if it's that full at 12:30 AM, what's it like at 5:00 PM??? They charge for EVERYTHING ... internet, parking, phone calls etc ... had we any need to stay longer than 7 hours, this would have been bothersome ... The front desk staff (which consisted of one person, who was in absentia when we got there; first handled an airline crew member ahead of us [We are Starwood Gold]). The shuttle back to the airport was just as chaotic, with a stop at the Embassy Suites ... Do yourself a favor, stay at the Doubletree or Hilton Garden Inn ... both just off Sepulveda.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sungoer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was worth every penny we spent, we found a great deal on PriceLind (US $67 + taxes). We weren't expecting anything great for this price, but were very pleasantly surprised when we got there. We only stayed 1 night on our layover, the air traffic could have been annoying had we been staying there for longer. The rooms were newly decorated, with very comfortable beds, flat screen tv, comfy chairs. The room service was excellent as well, not cheap, but what room service is??!! The food was excellent, with very prompt service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Makenna09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of our American trip for one night before we left to go to Canada. Although the hotel is very close to the airport and they offer a free shuttle service this hotel wasn't up to standard!!! Firstly we were booked in a room and when we got to the door, we opened it and to our horror there was already someone booked in there, so after we got the scare of our lives we went down to reception and all they did was change our rooms!! After this I felt like the hotel was not safe and I was extremely let down and after traveling all day I had had enough. So I let loose, and gave them a peace of my mind! After a 20 minute conversation, the hotel upgraded us to the top floor, and gave us free dinner and free breakfast. Although I was still very annoyed that they booked us into someone elses room, they at least seamed a little sympathetic and the manager was kind enough to offer us the free meals. Even though the location of this hotel is perfect for a quick getaway to the LAX, I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Ash68Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night.I made a mistake when booking and booked the wrong date.Which was no issue but the staff member at the desk was very ignorant about it.Just said you have have booked the wrong date then stood silently ,i asked do you have any rooms available for tonight? To which he said yes we have .They then proceeded to charge me twice the price I had originally paid.He did not offer or seem to want to offer any help what so ever.The beds were comfortable. The room was dated and could could use an update.We were on a family vacation and stayed at 7 hotels in 3 weeks.This was the only hotel i could say a negative word about.Once bitten twice shy I will never stay here ar at another sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “3 minutes away from LAX with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELEVERYTWOWEEKS
Reviews.Content: Very nice lobby and service at the front desk. If you need free shuttle service, here is where you want to stay. Price is very economical comparing to the hotels on the same street. Starbucks in the bobby, but the hours are short. Room is okay, but a little aged. I would give the exterior 4 stars, lobby 3.5 stars, room 3 stars, service 4 stars, location to LAX 5 stars, food around the hotel 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms overall...but service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: jlg22
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Los Angeles but I am currently living overseas. I booked this hotel for about 5 nights during my summer vacation when I came back home for a visit. I booked this hotel through Hotwire, so I didn't know which hotel I would be staying in until I entered my credit card info and paid. It said 4 star hotel, but in reality the hotel itself was more of a 3 star hotel with 2 star service. However I only paid about $80/night for the room and I think the self service parking was like $12 a day or something like that. The room itself was pretty good, with large bed and contemporary furniture. One of the few problems I had with the room was the bathtub. As other reviewers have mentioned, there was the problem of slow water drainage and the tub was a little chipped around the drain. The other problem was that there was a door that separated my room to the room next door, and you could hear the family next door with their noisy kids, whenever they were in their room. Other than those things, I was generally satisfied with the room itself. However, the main problem was the service. At the front desk, the staff seemed a bit aloof and unprofessional at times. Quite frankly, some of them (even though they were dressed professionally) spoke and acted a bit "ghetto" and it seems like they weren't trained in proper etiquette. That wasn't the main issue though. The main problem was that I had requested a small fridge to be sent to my room 3 times. The first 2 times, I had called the front desk and they told me it would be there in 30 minutes. 1.5 hours later...no fridge. SO I called again and spoke to the same guy and he sounded surprised that it hadn't come yet and said he would call maintenance to see what was going on. Another 30 minutes passed by and nothing. So I went outside my room and saw one of the housekeeping ladies and explained to her my problem. She was really nice and on a walkie talkie informed another man of my problem, and within about 15 minutes, they had brought up the fridge and set it up. So, the housekeeping and maintenance people did a good job, but the "unprofessional/ghetto" front desk person didn't. I think he was just being lazy. I wonder who hired that guy and I'm guessing their criteria for hiring hotel staff must be quite low. The hotel itself was just ok. The pool could have been in better condition, and the fitness room was being renovated, so the temporary fitness room was tiny. The elevators do shake a bit. The only other comment I have was of the shuttle driver. He was a really nice and funny man. I think he must have been Latino and I forgot his name, but he made the trip from the airport to the hotel very fun. I hope they pay him well. However, I think the shuttle is not just for the Sheraton hotel but for other hotels in the area as well. But overall, for $80/night it was a decent value I think. It could've been a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: We landed at LAX at 11ish, and being from the east coast I figured that I really didn't want to drive to a hotel in West Hollywood still on east coast time so I booked a stay at the Sheraton Gateway for one night. It was a great stopover. After collecting our luggage it was a very quick trip on a shuttle provided at the airport right to the hotel. Check in was incredibly quick and we were in our 3rd floor room. The view wasn't great but we were only staying one night so it didn't matter. Starwood hotels are our favorites so this was an easy pick. The bed was super comfortable. The only complaint I had, was that the bathroom was kind of dark especially if you were in the shower with the curtain closed. The hotel has a super workout facility with lots of treadmills and elipiticals and weight machines and dumbells. One of the things that I noticed right away (and something I was concerned about) was the noise from the airport since we were so close. It was never a problem for us. We couldn't hear any planes coming OR going so it never interupted our sleep. Check out was at noon so we got up early and picked up our rental and was all ready to being our vacation fully refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: HotMama168
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Done in 2 min. Room is as pictured. Bathroom was cramped, not newly remodeled as the room, but it was ok for 1 night. Toiletries were nice and were Bliss products. Service was great and had absolutely no problems. We got to use the business center to print out our boarding passes for Jet Blue the next day. I'd stay there again. It was perfect for a layover for us.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Magoo190
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton Gateway on several occasions and have never been disappointed. The staff is friendly, helpful and have always been able to fill my request. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the 24-hour shuttle service, though a standard for any hotel in the area, is always helpful. They have a great lounge to hang around after a long flight or before flying out. Rates are very reasonable. I don't stay anywhere else when I travel to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality business/airport hotel - one of the very best"”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a high quality business/airport hotel. The positives include the shuttle service from/to the airport; the effecient staff; room quality; computer access in the lobby; and very comfortable and modern rooms. Of particular note of excellance was the restaurant bar. Exceptional food and drinks presented by a friendly staff. Be certain to try the happy hour specials. I found nothing negative about this property and would certainly stay again. I have stayed at nearly every hotel on the Century Blvd airport strip. I would have to stay, based on this stay of two days, that the Sheraton Gateway is the overall best.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for stop overs!”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over night between 2 late night flights. We arrived at LAX around midnight and the shuttle arrived after about a 10 minute wait. The entire flight crew from our flight jumped on the shuttle with us and we all headed to the Sheraton Gateway. The lobby is very nice with comfy chairs and a sophisticated feel to it. We checked in straight away and were given a room on the 9th floor. We headed to bed as soon as we got to the room, however when we tried to turn on the A/C we couldnt get it to work. I rang down to reception to see if there was a trick and they offered to send some one from maintenance up. He was there within 5 minutes and for roughly 10 minutes attempted to fix it. He then said he would have to move us to another room and quickly rang down to reception and found out that the room next door was empty. He let us in to the room and offered to help us move of things. He turned on the A/C for us and then arranged for a porter to bring up the new room keys for us. It was all very organised and very friendly. We had a brilliant nights sleep in a wonderfully comfortable and huge bed and woke up watching the planes landing at LAX. We couldnt hear a sound as they landed but it was great to watch them. We had breakfast at the subway down the road and then checked out. The hotel held our luggage and we brought tickets for the Ocean Express shuttle which leaves from just outside the hotel and takes you to the beach and 2 shopping centres for $3 each return. We thought the hotel was great and would throughly recommend it for stop overs.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, good value, good location, all round great!”
Reviews.Author: kadamoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway at Lax following a trip back to LA. We had a 17 hour flight with a 3 year old, so checked into the hotel after the flight, to get some sleep before seeing friends and family. The shuttle was fast , check in quick, really good room, 2 great queen beds, nice bedding, and good sized room. I was worried about the noise being so close to the airport, but it was fine. Used the pool briefly next day, nice, clean and relaxed. USed the Starbucks in the lobby, but slow, and pricey but nothing major. We did order room service and it was crazy price, they charged for delivery, tex, room service, and I think we paid nearly $60 for 1 kids snack, salad and burger, and maybe 1 soft drink. I think this is the way the hotels around the airport make thier money, from tired hungry guests. Luckily I got a good price on the hotel and was all round happy, just might be good idea to pick up food outside, (not their is much close) and the airport is expensive. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Bargain”
Reviews.Author: kimrMa
Reviews.Content: After traveling cross country and arriving late at night having a beautiful hotel available on airport property within 20 minutes of landing with good food available was fantastic. Beautiful hotel, very clean, good (Though pricy) food available late. Shuttle service to and from the terminals is available every 15 minutes. Not much available in the area but price, quality, cleanliness and proximity to the airport more than make up for that. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Barely acceptable . . .”
Reviews.Author: Pausanias
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway was chosen for us by our cruise line, Noble Caledonia, and certainly wasnâ€™t the place we would have chosen. Itâ€™s a typical soulless chain hotel, convenient to the airport and thatâ€™s about the best one can say for it. Our room, on the 7th floor, had a view over the runways and decor that might have been modern were it not for the dreadful darkwood monster cabinet that dominated the room yet held only a flatscreen TV. What an eyesore and what a waste of space! The bathroom was straight from the 1970s. As there isnâ€™t even a fast food joint within easy walking distance, we tried their own steakhouse and that was a huge mistake - they botched up a main course, managed an all-time low for a Caesar Salad (no dressing at all, dried-up chicken) and topped it off with lethargic service. Breakfast was a slight improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: form2
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a spot to rest your head that is conveniently located near LAX. The Sheraton is it. You can't go wrong it's literally one of the last hotels before the airport entrance. i've been missing a lot of flights lately. So this time around I wanted to be sure that my friend and I would be right next to the action without having to actually sleep at the airport. It was a good decision. There are so many hotels located near LAX they might as well put up some casinos and make it like Las Vegas. I thought Sheraton would just be a run of the mill standard corporate hotel (which it is) but it is also well kept, has a friendly staff, upgraded rooms, and very unexpectedly comfortable beds! Considering it's geographic location near the airport it was safe for me to assume we would be hearing a lot of air traffic, but no sound could be heard from the outside. Now that's a hotel you wouldn't mind having a layover in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on Priceline--less than $60 before fees”
Reviews.Author: usd2busmc
Reviews.Content: Great room, easy check-in, and a short walk to Budget Rental. Comparable to the Renessiance. Check in easy, and was not made to feel like a cheapo even though I booked through third party reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise - excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Hotelblog24_com
Reviews.Content: We were not sure, where to stay fo the last night, before going back to Europe and read the reviews about this great hotel on tripadvisor. So we gave it a try. The staff is extremly great and helpful. The checkin procedure is really quick and they appologized for closing the lounge for renovation. So as a SPG-Platinum member you receive free coupons for appetizers at the bar which tasted really great. We booked the hotel a few hours before arrival and requested higher floors and airport view. During checkin everything was prepared and we received a wonderful upgrade. Breakfast buffet on the next morning was good and the staff also very helpful. If you request a late checkout (flight at 9.15pm at LAX) housekeeping called us, to let us know if they can do anything for us or bring new towels, they will glad to assist. A perfect location for a relaxing trip with a wonderful staff. I can promise, I know where to stay on my next business trip to Los Angeles. Thank you Sheraton Gateway Airport

Reviews.Title: “Great room and amazing staff - - I was sorry to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Pamz-on-the-road
Reviews.Content: I wound up here because I was changing planes and needed a spot close to the airport. What a great find! From the van driver to the front desk clerk to the restaurant servers to the phone operators, EVERYONE who works here was fabulous. The room was lovely, clean and bright, and breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful. This is the kind of place that business travelers dream of. I was sorry to have to leave, but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “All you expect and more from Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about as close as you can get to LA airport! It is 1st class all the way. Well appointed, spacious rooms offering every comfort and style. Our room had a nice view over the city at sunset and it was the perfect place for weary travellers to relax for the night, ahead of an early morning flight the next day. We could order a meal at the bar and take it back to our room and though only burgers and fries, it was fine. There was a complimentary airport shuttle from the hotel in the morning and all major car rental companies are in the vicinity for those wanting a car. If you want to be close to the airport for that early morning flight, then this is where you want to stay! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Greate hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: My first Impression was not positive at the Sheraton Gateway. When we pulled up to the hotel the valet Attendant asked me to move the vehicle after I got out of the vehicle and was preparing to unload our luggage. ( I was the only one in the area) This was annoying. He should have flagged me to drive into another area or lane, instead of waiting for me to get out of the vehicle. The hotel is very close to the LA airport. Valet parking is an extra cost as well as Internet access. The reservation desk was quick and courteous and had an upgraded room prepared in advance, (one of the fastest check-in to date) the room was a semi suite which is a larger then your standard room and updated to include a plasma screen and contemporary design. The bed was very comfortable; I thought I was at a Westin. Overall, the room and hotel was clean and comfortable. Room service was prompt, but we had to wash the coffee cups to remove brown spots. I would give this place 5 out of 5 if we did not experience the annoying valet or the dirty coffee cups.

Reviews.Title: “HENRY GARAY - YOU SAVED THE DAY !!”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: I am taking the time to write this review solely because of the treatment I received from Henry Garay, the front desk manager who happened to be working at the time I arrived in the hotel. I have written many reviews concerning Starwood properties here on tripadvisor - and in not a single one have I had a negative thing to say about the hotel in question. But, this experience was not all that wonderful. I was taking a 16 hour flight from SE Asia and I wanted to secure a nice room for my wife and son who I had not seen for a couple weeks. I took the time to call the hotel from Thailand the night before, at my expense, to make the pre-arrangements to ensure everything would be set up upon my arrival late into the evening. As a Starwood platinum member, I had hoped that the arrangements that were agreed upon between myself and a manager at the hotel the night before would be carried out without a hitch. This did not happen. I will spare the details of the very disappointing situation i encountered when I arrived at the hotel- suffice it to say that the treatment I received was unbecoming of a guest to this hotel, not to mention a Platinum SPG guest. HENRY GARAY stepped into the picture and treated me in a professional manner, doing the absolute best he could to remedy the situation. While he could not provide me with the room I was promised, he did everything in his power to make me comfotable and I greatly thank Henry. I strongly suggest that if you are a gold or platinum SPG member that you ONLY ask to speak with Henry. He is a gentleman and a professional at what he does - HE TRULY CARES ABOUT THE HOTEL GUEST. Upper management of this hotel - please try to get all of your staff to treat gusts the way Henry Garay does. My general comments about the hotel: (1) elavators are very slow - management should try to figure out a way to get a specific elevator up to the higher floors; (2) Club lounge breakfast was nice; (3) be careful if you want to go to the steakhouse in the hotel as my family did on Sunday night - it was closed; (4) clean rooms; (5) very convenient to LAX airport, especially with free shuttle; (6) fairly priced; (7) staff just not as friendly as most other Sheratons I have encountered, excluding Henry Garay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for one night airpot overnight”
Reviews.Author: GreenCardWedding
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline (given hotel after they accepted my bid). We arrived at 3am after a 3 hour flight delay from Boston. The shuttle brought us right to the hotel and the girl at check in took one look at us and said we could have a 2pm late check out. The room was enormous w/a very comfy king bed and lounge suite. It smelled a little smoky although the whole floor was nonsmoking. We had a really neat view of the airport so watched planes land in the mroning while having a coffee. It was very very quiet in the room. We checked out the next day for our international flight. I was overnight there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: holltmarie2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! It looks so big and fancy inside. The lounge area is so comfy. The bar is big and the pool is clean, But there are some things that need to be changed. The room is supplied with bottled water but be sure not to drink it or you will pay $5 for it. The drinks at the bar are so expensive. I paid $12 for a margarita. The pool is very shallow. I think they need to clean out the jaccuzzi out once in awhile, The Wi Fi is not free in your room but free in the lobby. It didnt make much sense but ok. Also the maids come to clean your room so early!!! But everyone was polite and nice. The pool is open ;ate and the view is beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “All in all a great hotel; conveniently located--GREAT BEDS”
Reviews.Author: brownman
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is centrally located. The lobby is big and has free Wi-Fi and a full service Starbucks. We booked on Priceline and got the same service as everyone else. The staff was super friendly and we even parked our car out in front while we checked in and took our bags to our room. The valet held our keys for us. We checked in about 11 AM with no problem and no line. As someone mentioned, the elevators are slow because the two elevator banks are not connected so you have to hit the button on both elevators. This means that during almost every elevator ride, the elevator opens up without anyone getting on. Use the 3 elevator bank as we found that to be the fastest. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had a view of the LAX parking lots. We heard some plane noise but it was not disturbing. The beds were so comfortable. The bathroom is a bit small and needs renovation but it did the job. The one thing that we all noticed was that the room was very dusty. It looks like the cleaning staff doesn't dust the rooms. I walked by a cleaning cart and it did not have a duster. Parking is an issue. $24 for the valet parking but there is free parking along 98th street directly behind the hotel. There's a two hour limit 8 AM - Midnight. So effectively you can park from 10 PM to 10 AM without moving your car. The parking is right outside of Easy Park-LAXâ€Ž so it's safe but the street fills up quickly. You can park in the Easy Park-LAXâ€Ž. We found this to be convenient and it's just across the street from the hotel. We almost always found parking in the first couple rows. Tell them that you are a guest at the hotel and you can pre-pay for about $13/day with in/out privileges. The area is really safe. I even got back past 1 AM one night without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it but basic room”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeeler777
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of days to de jet lag in Los Angeles before moving on. Hotels in LA and particularly around the airport are fairly pricey. I would not pay their overpriced rack rate but I got a great deal on Hotwire at the last minute. They have a free shuttle than runs from LAX. Because we arrived early and our room was not ready they gave a handicapped room, saying it was bigger. Well, if that bigger I would not like to have a regular room. It had one king size bed but I have certainly stayed in cheaper hotels with bigger rooms than this. Upsides were that the TV was a large flat screen, and the bathroom was very clean. However, there was no fridge or microwave in the room which was very disappointing. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. The bar and restaurant are very expensive ($7 for a light beer). There are no major restaurants close by but a 10 min walk with get you to a local shopping centre with lots of choices. If you look at a couple of the office blocks nearby they do have reasonable coffee shops on the ground floors where you can have breakfast. I was amazed at the noise in our hallway at 3.00am in the morning. Also the room next door had his TV up full tilt at 5.00am in the morning so we had a couple of restless nights. I knocked on the door of the room next door but they wouldn't answer. However, the TV was turned down so presumably they knew what they were doing wrong. There is one thing that really annoys me with these upmarket hotels. Given that they charge exhorbitant prices for the room, one would think they would give their 'executive guests' free internet access. In much cheaper hotels internet is often offered free along with breakfast. It was a rip off at $10.95 and to make it worse the connection kept dropping out in our room. Meaning I had to go to the lobby to use it. To their credit, when I mentioned it at the desk they immediately offered us another room. I declined because we were settled in where we were. So they immediately refunded the internet charges. In short, the hotel was fine but I would not pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient Location - No in-room Safe though.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a recent trip and were pleasantly surprised. Great decor in the hotel, very modern ... So LA.... The express line for SPG members was great.. The room was big and funishings new, we had a fantastic view overlooking the airport and runways and out over the iconic LAX sign which changes colours. The bed was super comfortable. One big disappointment is that there was no in-room safe. I hate this especially because you are staying somwhere where you have no idea who will be accessing your room while you arent there.. . That aside, there is a well equipped, (pay per millisecond of use) business centre and a cool pool area to hang out if you are lucky enough to have the notorious "marine layer" of fog burn off in the afternoon. If you will be going to and from the hotel quite frequently . You can avoid the extortionist valet parking rates - ( and having to tip the valet each time) by using the self park facility at the back of the hotel. $13 a day I think it was. There is also a star bucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, but the executive lounge was overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DMenist
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasent hotel. Parking is somewhat difficult and as we all know if you get a ticket in l.a., its gonna cost big $$$ We were on the 11th floor. We had access to the executive lounge which was pretty sad, but they forgot to bill us (hahaha) There was only one heated food item beef, pork, or fish. They had a big lcd t.v. (in the lounge) and various food items (still in the lounge) My only problem with the lounge was the fact that the attendent was on a guest computer the whole friggen time. Otherwise it was very convieniently near the airport with a shuttle

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before leaving from LAX. I had stayed at various hotels in the LAX area over the past few years and this was by far the most comfortable. I booked on Priceline for around $80 including tax and service charges, so it was a great deal. Parking was pricey at $24 for valet, but by far the easiest option. The suite was very comfortable and clean - it was just what we needed. Didn't try the bar and restaurant, but there is a full Starbucks in the lobby. Free wireless access in the lobby but not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/ convenient airport location”
Reviews.Author: kristieds
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience with my stay over Memorial Day weekend. I was on the Club Level which had a lounge for breakfast in the am and appetizers in the pm. The staff was very nice and the hotel was nice. My room was nice and the beds were so comfortable. Love their linens. I was very appreciative of the convenient hotel shuttle to and from the airport. The only downside was I thought the hotel restaurant and room service was pretty expensive. Overall, I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: At just under $75, including taxes, from Priceline, we felt the room was a good deal. Room large enough and comfortable. We did not rent a car until the next day (walked a mile to Hertz rather than relying on shuttles), so did not have to content with high parking fee. We arrived late and were glad the lobby /bar was still open and serving food (and not just snacks) at 1 a.m. Only breakfast option, apart from the main restaurant, was a Starbucks. I did hear some aircraft and auto traffic noise from our room in the morning, but nothing major (my wife heard nothing). Not sure if the beds were as comfortable as those at the nearby Hilton but the price was better, at least by using Priceline. We waited perhaps 5 minutes for the hotel shuttle at LAX at midnight. You do need to look carefully, since many shuttles are shared by several hotels; you might find one bus serving 3 different hotels so you need to look carefully at the electronic signs. This hotel is one of the very closest to the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “convient for ongoing flights”
Reviews.Author: Deb70
Reviews.Content: Rooms a good size, clean, room service not very good could not understand I wanted slippers they bought sugar. good size gym, internet expensive being $5.95 for 30minutes. courtesy shuttle to airport, we usually stay at Embassy suites North which I think would still stay there again as alot more room and breakfast and managers drinks but have to shop around. Starbucks in the hotel made the best coffee I had in the time I was in america. We told the girl as well.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in LAX.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to being SPG members and wanting a hotel close to the airport. Check-in â€“ Everything went accordingly to plan. However, on entering our suite the room was incredibly dark and gloomy. We rang reception and asked whether we could have another suite. They were very accommodating and happy to please without any dramas. Room â€“ Our â€œnew â€œ suite 659 was enormous with a generous lounge room with sofa couches, coffee table, working desk and TV cabinet. The king size bed was slightly off to the side with good views of the airport and was exceptionally comfortable with big fluffy pillows. The bathroom was normal size with shower over the bath and a good vanity unit. Facilities â€“ There is a shuttle bus that goes to the airport every 10 minutes. A excellent outdoor swimming pool with plenty of comfortable deck chairs. There are plenty of taxiâ€™s available if you want to escape into town or down to the local Manhattan Beach. (which we did..) Restaurants â€“ We had dinner at Shulaâ€™s 347 and had a lovely steak meal with attentive staff. We also enjoyed a quick lunch at the Brassiere Restaurant which was okay too. Overall : An excellent Airport Hotel with superb facilities, staff and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable LAX Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than 10 times over the past few years. Its a modern, Clean, comfortable hotel just a few minutes from LAX airport by way of a free shuttle. Check in staff are fast, courtous and friendly and the rooms are typical sheraton decor, the bathrooms are a little dated but clean with plush towels. If you are staying at this hotel and have some time to kill, there is an Ocean Trolly that picks up just outside the hotel on Century Blvd and goes to Manhattan Beach, then Manhattan Beach Mall and El Segundo Outlet Mall, it cost $3 each round trip and you can hop off/on. Manhattan Beach is lovely and has lots of wonderful boutique shops, Restaurant etc. It also has a Jamba Juice, Yummy! Manhattan Beach Mall, has lots of shops inc a Apple Store, CVS Drug Store, Victoria's Secret, Pottery Barn, Islands Restaurant and lots of other Shops and Eateries. If anyone has any questions please dont hesitate to ask, Have a great Trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good service, clean room, good price”
Reviews.Author: trinitron436
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel (like most in the LAX area) but they've done some improvements since I was last there including new bedding and plasma tv's in my room. Looks like they're doing some work in the lobby too. The Shula's restaurant is expensive but I got a decent meal at the bar the following night. Very convenient to LAX and less expensive than the Marriott and Westin. All in all, a decent airport hotel that seems to be trying to get better.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Smelly dirty rooms. Decor needs serious upgrading. Restaurant seriously overpriced and over rated. $12.95 for slow Internet. Overpriced and would no way recommend staying. Look elsewhere unless this is $50 a night

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking employee theft...”
Reviews.Author: jrzyshawn
Reviews.Content: I know I should not have left anything of value in the car, but I forgot. I just simply forgot. I inadvertently left a digital camera in the glove box, a closed glove box when I parked the car and when I checked for it in the morning it was gone. .. I notified the Manager who in turn referred me to the Supervisor for the valets. I filled out a claim form with them and received a letter telling me, too bad for you. We are not responsible for items left in the vehicle. I know this is something I could have avoided, but I just forgot it in the glove box. I am furious that the valets are rifling though guestâ€™s cars and opening the glove box looking for items to pilferage. For what itâ€™s worth, I once dropped my wallet in a rental car in Las Vegas and did not realize it. The valet that parked the car found it and notified the front desk who in turn notified me. This guy could have robbed me like the employees at the Sheraton LAX, but he did not and he was rewarded for his honesty. So just a heads up for everyone traveling to the Sheraton LAX and valet parking a car with them. BE AWARE. If you accidently leave anything of value in the vehicle, even if it is out of plain sight, they may search the vehicle and steel from the people that help ensure they receive a paycheck. Needless to say, I am donâ€™t giving my business to the Sheraton LAX when I am in L.A. from now on. I should have noted that when speaking with the parking manager/supervisor, he indicated this is a common problem they have among their parking staff and was not surprised that it happened. He even seemed to know just which employee parked the vehicle possibly had stolen the item. Hey Sheraton LAX, I hope that $150 camera was worth all the lost business that myself and my colleagues will now be giving to other hotels when we need to stay at LAX

Reviews.Title: “I was quite surprised how nice and renovated this hotel is..”
Reviews.Author: LKnSF
Reviews.Content: Quite surprised for an older airport hotel but it is renovated and done quite well - in a nice masculine way. Great food, nice lil gym - could be bigger but overall, great - we walked to the hotel from the terminal - it is a hike but after the time on the plane, happy to do it.

Reviews.Title: “They must have bought the last two stars”
Reviews.Author: mirrorshirt
Reviews.Content: This place does not deserve 4 stars. The room we have is a disappointment. It is so dated and the restroom is dirty. Everything is so expensive. They charge $4.50 for a bottle of water that is worth $1 and they tack on two extra kickbacks to themselves for room service. The food at the bar was taken from cardboard boxes and microwaved and then marked up 800%. My understanding is that a four star hotel is supposed to be nice but this isn't. The hallways look like those in the movie "the shining". It is a 2 star hotel that has connections with someone on a rating board somewhere so they purchased the extra 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Dependable and Convenient to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastTripMaster
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the people who diss this place. Are we talking about the same hotel here? I have been staying at this hotel for several years now whenever I fly in or out of LAX. It is super close to all the terminals, and I have found the hotel shuttle to be, likewise, super convenient. I have always had pleasant and efficient service at the check-in desk. The staff has always been great at accommodating any of my requests. Parking has always been easy - valet works well for me as does the self-park behind the hotel. I've never had a bad experience with either. Restaurants and bar are really good for in-hotel dining. My rooms and bathrooms have always been clean, the beds comfortable, and room service has been great. For my needs, this hotel has always been my "sure bet" to make entrances and exits from LAX a more restful and pleasant experience. Now many of my friends do the same thing I do. We live a two hour drive from the airport and having the Sheraton Gateway there to remove some of the stress of traveling has been a wonderful thing. No, it isn't a resort or super fancy hotel - it caters to the business traveler - and, in my opinion, it does a great job for its niche and for a super reasonable price. I think it really gives a great value. If I want super-duper fancy or deluxe, or a more social hotspot, I'll go stay at a resort somewhere. When I stay at LAX I'm focused on my flights and how to make my getting to and from them convenient and less stressful. This hotel and its employees have consistently done exactly what I've wanted and needed for years. So far, never a bad experience for me. Only good ones.

Reviews.Title: “What a contrast!”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: In January we stayed at the Sheraton Hotel, Heathrow. It was old, drab and 5 years over due a make over. By contrast, and for much the same price, the Sheraton Gateway is modern, fresh, spacious double bedded room and all the facilities you require for a comfortable, relaxing stay. If you check my review history you will see that I rarely award 5 stars but I really could not fault this property. Starwood have work to do to standardise their properties. They could do worse than use the Sheraton Gateway as their benchmark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if being near airport is important”
Reviews.Author: egatrop
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Price is consistent with location and scale of hotel. Only feature that was inconsistent with the high quality of the hotel, was the bath/shower- The grout was moldy, dirty. Restaurant and bar is very expensive. A short walk up Sepulveda Blvd (north) takes you to a few unique restaurants and chain restaurants including McDs and Subway. Staff at hotel is great. Shuttle to/from airport is good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price deal”
Reviews.Author: mydogrules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while attending conference down the street in a different hotel. Clean spacious, well appointed rooms. Why do these hotels around the LA still charge $12 a day for wireless internet? Got good deal on room, paid first night regular price got 2nd night half price. Shuttle service to and from airport. Lots of staff in lobby to answer any questions. Parking not on site unless you do valet at $24/night, otherwise have to park behind hotel across street in a long term park n fly lot. Flat screen tvs were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not a property expecting you to come back”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: This property does not really honor Starwood Preferred Guest program. No PSG floor or lounge no extras provided at other properties. Room was nice but the rest of the property was very average. I defy you to find out how to get to the pool. There also was no hottub with the pool. Menu selection at the restaurants was limited. The reason to stay here is for proximity to the airport but that is it. There are much nicer Starwood properties in the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: DavidHaup
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Gateway airport due to meeting near airport. Would not stay there again as I am sure there are better alternatives. Everything was just average. While the staff were friendly, they were not all that sharp. ordered room service and asked for wake up call and communication was not great. Hotel is right next to airport and you can hear planes all night long, room vibrates. also disappointing to have to pay $11 for internet access. should be free. Elevators require you to press button on both sides to wat for elevator and this results in stopping on many floors unnecesarily on way down. No restaurants within walking. firness center was good. Bathrrom door awkwardly bumps up against toilet making it incolvenient to go in and out, poor architecture on that one. All in all staff tried but I would not stay again. I find Marriotts to be consistently better than Sheratons. will try Marriott Manhattan beach next time

Reviews.Title: “Parking is competitive”
Reviews.Author: Juztyne
Reviews.Content: I am actually quite surprised on some of the reviews listed on this site. I travel to Los Angeles regularly and I have stayed in a number of hotels at the airport. Out of all the airport hotels at the LAX, I think Sheraton Gateway is one of the best ones there. All of the hotels at the airport charges parking. The charges for self and valet parking at the Sheraton is no more than other hotels in the area. This is Los Angeles. Everywhere charges parking in Los Angeles!

Reviews.Title: “Alright for airport, wouldn't stay otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Honeym00ner_86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely getting on. The room seemed a bit dated and the shower was horrible. The room itself was comfortable however. The parking here is confusing - it seems like the only way to park is to valet park which is annoying as we would prefer to park ourselves. It was okay for the night before the airport, but would only stay here for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: Johnc4pa
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of the better airport hotels. It isn't anymore. The first change that I really don't like is the airport shuttle is shared with other hotels. What this now provides you is a longer wait for the shuttle and when it does arrive it is full. After waiting to go back to LAX the hotel staff told me they had no control when it would come and taxis are available for $20 (for a 2 minute ride). The staff here has also become less than pleasant, even in the platinum lounge. You know it's bad when you give them a tip & they don't even smile or acknowledge you the next day. Many of the reviews here comment on the slow elevators, so I will just say a five minute wait to get to the lobby is typical here. I ate at the hotel bar each night and the food was very inconsistent, even for the same meal. BBQ shrimp was good one night, lousy the next. I do think the rooms here are pretty good. Flat panel TV with a good selection of channels. Given all the negatives, I would only consider this hotel again if I could get it for under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Gateway to the Gateway to the East (LAX)”
Reviews.Author: snowyphile
Reviews.Content: There is a shuttle to the terminals, and the rooms are quiet and reasonably clean. There is a nice outdoor pool, suitable for swimming laps, which one accesses through the fitness center (the latter looks good).

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: MikeoChicago
Reviews.Content: Since I have to pay to park anyway, I might as well valet. But I'd rather park in a convenient lot for free. I'm here for a conference, and I need Internet access. I have to pay seperately for access in my room and in the meeting room in the same bldg, which will total $66 during my 3 day meeting. Starbucks is in the lobby, but their coffee is burnt and full of grounds. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near LAX”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I usually stay that the Sheraton Gateway by LAX if I get a good rate, which I usually can find. I find the hotel consistently pleasant. My most recent stay I arrived around 1 PM worried that I would not have a room available, but the clerk was able to find one for me ("the room we set aside for you is not ready, but I am sure we can find one for you now".) She was friendly, asked me if I wanted a wake-up call, help with bags, etc. Very nice welcome. The room was facing the airport and I could see planes land and take off, but it was well sound proofed. Great bed and linen. Great water pressure in the bathroom. I don't think there were many other guests that night because there was absolutely no hallway noise. The fitness center here is a bit larger than you usually find, with several cardio machines, a rack of dumbells, two benches, and a small machine with pullies. Very nice. Bell service was excellent. I had to leave the hotel to run to the Hilton in the morning to get a rental car. I explained that I needed to leave the bag for "about a half hour". When I returned with the car and got out, they recognized me and brought the bag out without my having to enter the hotel. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “disappoitnig for a sheraton”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: This property should be ashamed to charge for the old, worn out rooms..particularly the bathrooms which have mold and peeling bathtubs in every room I have stayed in recently. The furniture is dirty, (stained chairs-yuk, unclean desk tops, and really grungy small bathrooms that have tubs that are chipped), and the carpeting often stained. The Sheraton company should be ashamed to have this hotel using the name as a franchise. Avoid at all costs. In addtition, airplane crews receive all the priority treatment, including getting on the shuttle before even disabled passengers! I guess if you work for an airline it is an okay place to stay. In need of major physical renovation in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate... until you add it up”
Reviews.Author: traci_9
Reviews.Content: I booked our reservation through continental.com to get the miles credit and received a pretty good rate. We checked in rather late after visiting Disneyland all day and was greeted at the desk by a not so friendly attendent. When asked where to park our car, he informed me they had valet. I told him I'd like to self park and he seem offended that I didn't want to valet park. He abruptly told me I needed to park behind the building - and that was that. We drove around the block and found what we hoped was the right parking lot - and then proceeded to drag our luggage around the block tothe front of the building - all the back doors were locked as it was late at night and our key cards would not open the doors! (Needless to say we didn't think of unloading while we were up front... wish we had). The room was nice and comfortable, but the charges for the internet were outrageous - especially on top of paying to park. When I checked out the next day the girl at the desk wasn't much nicer. Didn't even get a thank you. I assume maybe because the rate I got was so cheap? I don't know - but I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but”
Reviews.Author: bijou2006
Reviews.Content: beware of the following charges when you stay as other reviewers have kindly mentioned: 1) hi-speed internet ($12 per 24 hrs? depending on membership level) 2) parking as mentioned previously - $24 valet, $12 self (but not attached to hotel building) 3) if you stay on the Club floor, you still need to pay for beer/wine (breakfast/evening appetizers are served free) 4) bathrobe, wine opener must be requested (so that you will pay tip upon delivery) If you don't care for the above minor details it is a nice facility to stay for 1 night before your LAX flight. You have other choices, though.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for Parking!??”
Reviews.Author: seanlall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is almost right next doors to LA International Airport (LAX) with a free shuttle and that is why we chose it. We were flabbergasted that we had to pay for parking. About $12 for Self Parking which is about 3-4 minutes away from the front or $24 for Valet Parking. Never paid for parking while staying at any hotel before. Wish we were informed in advance. Room was ok. Had to pay for internet. Front Desk was mostly indifferent, but not rude. Elevators were very slow but are being renovated. Would not recommend other than proximity and convenience for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway LAX”
Reviews.Author: Lauri W
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on business/pleasure in Dec. Weekend rates were great...$109/night. They ended up giving me those rates during the week too. Probably because the pool was down and they were rennovating a set of elevators so had to use service elevators...not becoming of a 4 star hotel. They do have a 4 star restaurant...Shula's. Not quite kid friendly or budget friendly but the wait staff was great to look at! They had a breakfast/lunch restaurant on premisis but did not frequent. Requested and got a room close to elevators which is always nice at a hotel this size. Saved my walking for what really counted...Hollywood! Nice clean place, helpful staff. Great for the money! Their shuttle was very timely both to and from airport. Parking expensive and a few blocks from hotel so I just rented a car for one day and returned it that night...to a nearby Enterprise location that is very near this hotel. The Enterprise shuttle actually dropped me off at the hotel because they went past it, which saved me shuttle time from the airport. Probably wouldn't have stayed at this place if the business portion of the trip wasn't held there. I really wanted to stay at Eco Lodge because I heard there were more restaurants over there plus I could get a smoking room, but this worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, make sure to get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: peanut118
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through priceline for $60 a night on priceline, had I paid more I would have been disapointed but for that price it was worth saving the extra money in these tough times. Valet parking was $25 but well worth it if you are going to be in and out a bunch. The rooms were older and we had to move rooms due to the heat not working and the sink being clogged in our first room. In the second room everything worked fine but the shower seemed to have mildew or soap scum in both rooms. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and that alone with the starbucks in the lobby were the highlights of this hotel. If you are looking for someplace cheap to crash for the night, this place is it, if you are looking for more I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ARII
Reviews.Content: It is not the first time I have stayed there. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest. Sheraton is normally synonymous with quality and comfort. Still, I was disappointed this time with my overnight stay. Half of the elevators did not work and the room clearly needed upgrading and refurbishing. More, the buffet breakfast is not up to one's expectations. Compared to other hotels of the same category in the vicinity,- the Westin in particular-the Sheraton Gateway has obviously lost part of its gloss and therefore become too expensive for what it actually offers.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel Bar None”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST airport hotel property I have ever stayed at. There is almost nothing to do around LAX, very few restaurants, bars, fun things to do. So if you have to be there for a nite before you leave town, this is the best hotel to stay at. By far! The vibe feels almost European, maybe b/c several of the front desk people are, maybe because of the very sleek feeling of the hotel. I feel more like I am in the downtown of a fun city than at an airport area with nothing going on. Front desk is always helpful, and the lobby is always abuzz. Always, and in a good way. There are some very hip, cool chairs in the lobby bar area, and they are always full. The rooms are nicely updated. Try and get a room where you are facing the runways. It is pretty cool. By the way there are often very good prices at this location. Do not bother with staying at the Westin, which often is a more upscale Starwood brand. This is a MUCH better overall hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: jayjazz
Reviews.Content: I was there over the weekend for a conference for my job. Had I payed my own money, I would have been very disappointed. For starters there was very little hot water in the morning. So having to get up to a cold shower every morning was not that pleasant. Next, the public elevators were not working so you had to ride the service elevators with the employees. Also the service elevators were only running one at a time; so most of the time you were waiting anywhere from 3-5 minutes to get on an elevator that wasn't packed with patrons as well as employees. That was very uncomfortable considering that there were sometimes where I had to ride the elevator with the wait staff who had just cleared off tables of dirty dishes or the cleaning staff who had loads of soiled linens; not cool. Furthermore, the bathroom in my room was extemely small. If I was there with my wife and child we would have had a hard time making it work. The rooms are not family friendly at all, and the bathtub was pealing. However,the beds and pillows were great, they were the best things about the room itself. The cleaning staff was exellent as well as the wait staff when we had our meals. I like the access that the hotel gives you to the Trolley so that you can go down to Manhattan Beach. Also, the Los Angeles by Night tour was awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles by Night”
Reviews.Author: jasonw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights over the weekend for a conference. Had my company not paid for the room, I would have had major issues. It was also my first trip to LA so the excitement allowed me to overlook some inconveniences. First, I would avoid this hotel until the elevators are updated. The main elevators are not working and the hotel suggests the service elevators. So we rode for four days with the soiled linen cart and the guy who cleans up after room service. Sloooooow elevators. Next, the room did not have hot water in the mornings. Hot was not a problem in the evening, but the early morning hours produced room temperature at best. The bathrooms should certainly be updated. On a positive note, the housekeeping and hotel wait staff were outstanding. Concierge were invaluable. Make sure you take the LA by Night tour. The concierge will book you for $55. They'll pick you up/drop you off at the hotel. If possible, go on a Sunday evening, as the traffic is almost non-existent. Also, take the $3 trolley from the hotel to Manhattan Beach. Awesome. Eat fish tacos at WAHOOS.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Park n' Fly is the reason I stay here (LAX Marriott has the same program), that and my SPG points. I like the hotel, it is convenient for the airport, the pool is nice and Shula's is good, but overpriced. The rooms are nice and the beds comfortable and they have good business services. All good so far. The negatives are the parking and the elevators. You HAVE to valet unless you want a half mile walk for self parking. The elevators have been messed up for a while now. They are so bad you have to use the staff elevators more often than not and it has been this way for a while. Will I stay here again? Yes. It has some good positives. It is a great hotel for someone looking for an overnight stay or maybe two days. If you have to been in L.A. more than two days there are a lot better places to stay and better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Red Light Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nieblax
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice within 2 weeks at this hotel and had 2 complete different experience. We book thru hotwire and paid $99 taxes in. The rooms were clean and the location is great for people coming in and out of the airport. There is also a trolley that can take you to Manhanttan Beach or some shopping malls for $3 round trip. Pretty decent. Our first experience was decent, professional staff, clean rooms.. However, our second experience.. What a nightmare. They had a "covention" of Rough Riders Bikers. They almost fill the entire hotel. People were yelling and partying all night.. Apparently, we were the only one on our floor not invited to the party. People knocked on our door ALL night (litterally we had to get up at 4:30 am to catch our flight and there were 4 people sitting in the hallway envoying another drink next to our room door.) We should have thought it would turned out this way when we saw police cars parked in front of the hotel when we checked in.. When we checked out, there was only 1 employee in the lobby and clearly he looked at uncomfortable as us... We saw prostitute in the lobby (it was not hidden - remember - we were intrudes into their "convention"), people driking from their Vodka bottles... Really, we could not get our of there fast enough... BEWARE... If that is the kind of group they want to rent their hotel too... They should let other customers know uo front what is to be expected for the week... The poor clerk at the lobby wanted to leave with us.. NOTHING in this hotel was under control.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a transit stop”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is showing its age, which is why reviews are mixed. Our room was OK, clean - though seemed a bit musty. The usual comfy Sheraton bed, important in a transit stop. Quiet, curtains darkened the room effectively. A/C not very efficient. Limited toiletries supplied, nice orange fragrance though. No safe. Usual coffeemaker, ironing board. Slow elevators, cigarette smell in corridors. Pool looked pleasant. Limited restaurant options on site. We ate at Shula's which was average - very slow service, waiter forgot part of our order, my beef tips sandwich was cold (but my husband liked his steak). Left early so cannot comment on breakfast options. Wouldn't stay here for sightseeing, but does the job for a transit stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Pinaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. It is close to the airport and easy to find. The room was excellent value for less than $100 with a large comfortable room. Staff were freindly and very efficient. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: mjmjdb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel out of convenience for a work trip (and because I'm a SPG member). I travel quite a bit and stay in mostly Ws and an occasional Westin or Sheraton. It's completely on par with other Sheratons I've stayed at in the past...everything pretty standard, clean, decent service, etc. It's also FAR better than most airport hotels (I normally won't stay in airport hotels as they tend to be yucky) The pool area is nice with a decent sized pool and nice furniture (like you'd normally find in a resort-type hotel). Check in was quick and friendly. My room (an executive suite) was large, nice and clean...it faced the street/runway and contrary to some of the other reviews, you could barely hear a thing. I ordered room service for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the quality. To those knocking this place (or to those wondering if you should stay here), please remember that it is (a) a Sheraton, so you should know what to expect (b) an airport hotel, and (c) very reasonably priced for what you're getting...and you generally get what you pay for. If you want luxury resort/Ritz type experience (which by some of the reviews is what I assume people honestly expected by their commentary), pay the money and stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: i got a good rate on priceline which was just as well because the rack rate would have been extortionate for the state of the bathroom and services. The bathroom was dirty; far more water came out of the tap than out of the showerhead on the shower setting; the water did not drain from the tub. Yuk. The "pinstripe" dark decor is depressing. The pool was nice early in the morning but in the afternoon there was a corporate function going on and since it's a small pool area it wasn't really inviting for an informal swim. Most of the lifts didn't work -- it took about 15 minutes to get down. The concierge sighed when I wanted to buy a stamp. The room service food was, as expected, overpriced and ridiculously salty. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheSun2008
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal through Hotwire. Very nice hotel - nice rooms, good breakfast, decent outdoor pool, handy for airport. We did however encounter a few problems 1) the free shuttle bus from the airport dropped us at the far end of the airport parking lot - a few minutes walk from the lobby - with 2 young children and 4 large cases this was not a good start! 2) the room we were assigned had not been serviced - beds not made, plate of food thrown across the floor, dirty bathroom - you get the picture. 3) Elevators slow, as some of them were out of order so getting back to reception after getting the unserviced room took a while 4) - and this was my biggest problem - the attitude of the front desk staff when reporting the unserviced bedroom - not a word of apology and no manners. Don't get me wrong - we enjoyed our stay and feel that we were just unlucky with the room, but I feel the front desk staff let the hotel down - I would have been very disappointed if we had paid the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel near LAX. It's reasonably priced (through Hotwire), comfortable, clean and most of all convenient with a 24hr shuttle running every 15-20mn to/from LAX. Would stay there anytime we need to catch a plane

Reviews.Title: “Not what I have come to expect from a "Sheraton"”
Reviews.Author: CharlesMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not quite up to the standards of what I would expect from a Sheraton Hotel. Lobby was open and spacious, but elevators were not working properly. Room had old furniture, mildew in the bathtub, and the tub did not drain properly (constantly stood in ankle-deep water during a shower). Close proximity to LAX is only plus. For $185 per night + tax at the AAA rate, I will look for another hotel in the future. Probably rate this a 2.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience at Sheraton Gateway LAX”
Reviews.Author: GojyoChan
Reviews.Content: First let me say, for the price I paid via Hotwire.com, this was an excellent deal! For the level of hotel, the price was hard to beat. Also, the decor of the hotel fits my personal style and so I loved the feel of the place. The bar was awesome and Shula's 347 restaurant inside the hotel was amazing (pricey, but amazing)! The beds are super comfy and the pool area was very nice too, the location was great since our vacation had us traveling all over the LA area. That being said there are some definite problems with this hotel, in fact, if I was someone who could afford their normal room rates, I would absolutely think this hotel was the pits! First, there is NO FREE PARKING whatsoever. That's pretty normal for Los Angeles but the Valet at the Sheraton is the biggest rip off I've ever heard of in my entire life! It's around $25.00 if you valet over 15 minutes!!!! If you elect to self park, it's $13.20 per night. Make sure you add that on top of your room rate when budgeting your vacation. The hotel messed up my bill which added insult to injury, they failed to charge me for my hotel bar tab but then charged me for a week of valet parking I didn't use. When I tried to fix the issue and was honest about not being charged for the bar tab, they blamed me and I had to deal with three different people to get it fixed. The bathrooms are a bit scuzzy considering the rest of the hotel and the TV's need to be updated. Also, it appears they have been having elevator issues for a long time now with only 2 of the 6 working so you have to take the service elevator. The brasserie for breakfast is overpriced and the service is super slow, I was shocked how bad it was in comparison to Shula's the night before. I recommend avoiding a handicapped accessable room as well. I would probably stay here again but It would have to be an even better deal than the one I got. It left our vacation on a sour note due to the billing issues and the price gouging parking issues. Just be prepared for what you're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eric2321
Reviews.Content: This is a very good airport hotel. There are 3 negative issues that are consistently mentioned in reviews here. Everything else seems random and subject to personal preferences. 1. ELEVATORS: are a real problem. Consistently did not stop at the 12th floor to pick me up on the way down. Had to get on any elevator that was heading "up" since it would not stop again on the way down. Very long waits at times. Housekeeping staff kindly let us use their elevator a couple times. 2. PARKING: $24 for valet, $12 for self-park. Self-park lot is behind the hotel across the street. This is a 5-10 minute walk in relative dark at night. Shuttle to parking lot is inconsistent. Can park on street behind hotel but you might get a ticket during day. 3. INTERNET FEES: $10.95 per day. True that internet is free in the lobby area (which is quite large). Otherwise, the hotel is fine. Beds are comfortable and room was clean. I can't figure out how anyone can stay at an airport hotel and then complain about hearing airplanes?! Bring earplugs or noise machine. Color scheme? Yes, kind of dark but this shouldn't ruin your stay! Long check-in line? I checked in very quickly. I noticed going through the lobby that there usually was no waiting at the desk, but a couple of times there was a line; that seems normal to me. This hotel is about as close as you can get to the airport. Would stay there again but would check to see if there is improvement with the elevators first.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star. 3 stars is pushing it.”
Reviews.Author: Metanoia
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was not a 4-star hotel as reported by Hotwire.com. First, when you walk in, you just feel like there's just something WRONG with this hotel. The lobby was dark, uninviting, and had uncomfortable furniture all around with bad loungy techno music playing.
