The hallways leading the rooms didn't match the motif of the lobby and rooms, which was definitely jarring. The rooms were small, the bathrooms were old and the tub was cracking and peeling, and the tiles were moldy. Water was not complimentary (as it should be for a 4-star) and the in-room coffee was horrid (Maxwell House!). The elevators weren't working either, 3 of 5 main elevators were out of service and we had to ride the service elevators along with the dirty linens and room service leftovers. Some guests even reported up to 30-minute wait times for the main elevators, as only some of the staff were notifying people about the elevator problem. Obviously, the hotel knew about the problem as there was a letter in the service elevator apologizing for the inconvenience. I would definitely not stay at this hotel again for what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Animal Friendly Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: BruceSydney_Aust
Reviews.Content: Just had a one night stopover at Sheraton LAX. Hotel is good quality with good Lobby, Gym and Pool facilities and right by the airport for a 24 hr layover. However after arriving and having a quick snooze in the afternoon, I awoke with bites all over me. We pretty quickly realised that there were fleas everywhere in the room. Staff were helpful and straight away moved us to a suite, but we now have to wash everything in our bags as they got right into our baggage and I had a rather uncomfortable 15 hour flight with flea bites itching all over me. Reception informed me whilst apologising that they are a "Pet Friendly Hotel" and that this would be how the fleas got into the room. Fleas and bugs can turn up anywhere but I would hope a Sheraton does more to check its rooms if a guest has had animals in there in future.

Reviews.Title: “good clean quality safe stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: heathrowterminal3
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from Sheraton. A nice clean hotel with plenty of room. The room was very nice and super comfortable bed. The only thing I could find that wasn't top notch was the bathroom tile and shower head could use a clean or replacement. But that is honestly the worse that I can say and it wan't a big deal at all! I just love a clean bathroom! The amenities were nice and there was a free shuttle to and from the airport and free wi fi. Breakfast wasn't a total rip off and had a large selection of premade stuff. I was perfect for a night to get over the jetlag!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmmfajitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights as a single traveller. I checked in at 2am and it was really quick and easy, my room was on the 14th floor and had two double beds, tv & writing desk and a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, i found it quite spacious. I didn't have breakfast in the lounge but did take full advantage of the Starbucks in the lobby and there's a small shop onsite for snacks too. In the evening i ate in the bar area which seemed understaffed but the waitress kept acknowledging me and the food was good. Really nice pool area. during the day i travelled by getting collected by a tour bus and one day i got a taxi to santa monica, it cost 50dollars, i discovered the blue bus could take me straight back for 75cents so i did that. The walk from the bus station (10mins) was pretty isolated and there were quite a few homeless people around though but i felt safe enough. The only criticism is there really is nothing around the hotel area to do but all in all i had a great stay at teh Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: calgaryGirl25
Reviews.Content: Because we booked through hotwire we thought we were getting only one bed. The person on the phone for Sheraton was rude but the people at the Gateway were really nice and getting two beds was no problem. Getting to and from the airport was great and getting the metro or santa monica buses near the hotel was easy. The beds were a bit hard and there was something up with the bathtub but overall a very nice hotel with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good at the Kor.”
Reviews.Author: Diegodad2
Reviews.Content: I was told Kor, the cool and hip company behind the Viceroy and Tides, runs this behemoth of a hotel on Century Boulevard, so when business dictated a stay at LAX, I booked the Sheraton Gateway. Sadly, the Kor style did not translate well to the Sheraton factory. The hotel has a cool front desk (where none of the employees seem to know what Kor is, by the way), but that's where it stops. The rest of the hotel is more Herman Munster than chic, with black and flannel gray making an already dark hotel positively lifeless. There are cavernous expanses without a single stick of furniture to break the monotony. The rooms are equally dark and the bathrooms very rundown. My bathtub had been chipped and painted over in at least 10 places. The bathroom tile was equally disgusting, as was the ubiquitous hair I found all over the sink and floor. Shula's was a bit disappointing, although the burger was excellent as was the undercooked apple crisp, but the bar/lounge was very bad and had surly service. But all of these seemed excellent compared to the lousy breakfast restaurant where the buffet seemed like left-overs. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thumping still in my head”
Reviews.Author: lanceralot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. When we arrived on the 4th, music was blaring at the swimming pool and could be heard across the lobby. When we got to our room on the 8th floor, the room was facing the pool and we were dismayed to find that we could heard the music from up there. Given that it was 4th of July, we thought...oh well, maybe this was a rare event and the manager had indicated that it'd be over at 8pm. The music kept going past 8pm and into 9pm. We didn't complain. Sunday afternoon comes around and they threw another party at the pool and the music was just blaring again. When I asked, the manager said it'd be over at 7pm. At 7:15pm, the thumping was just too much, so I called the front desk to ask when the music would be over, the front desk said 8pm. I decided enough was enough and went down to change our room. The manager said, oh it'll be over by 7:30pm. I said you can't entertain partygoers at the expense of disrupting an entire side of the hotel! Finally I got a new room facing the other way. I could hear the roar of the airplanes, but that was expected and I'd take that over the constant thumping any day. Room wise, it was ok. The bed slumped in the center and the shower/tub is in need of a renewal. The caulking were moldy and the stainless steel bars had rust streaks running down into the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfy”
Reviews.Author: Fab50Mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night (from NH) before a cruise. Very comfortable bed. Restaurant was nice & not too pricey (for LA). Rented a car to see some of LA, definitely need one. No place close to walk here. Use the valet parking. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: ann12172
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Sheraton hotels. This one was no different except for a few things: they do not tell you that you have to pay for parking (an extra$15/day, or valet for, I think $24). The parking lot was in the back of the hotel so it was pretty far. Luckily, the weather was nice. The interiors of the hotel were very nice: a little gift shop, a starbucks, nice rooms...bathroom too! Staff were nice. Like always, my room key didn't work at one point and I had to go all the way downstairs to get it reloaded. The concierge person took the time do it for me instead of having to wait in the line with the people needing to check in. I did not like that Sheraton would not let me add points to my rewards card though because I booked through Hotwire. The hotel is also very close to the airport (they have a shuttle)...so I could definitely hear airplane noise...not so bad though. Location wise, it was a pretty far drive to every where we had to go though. That sucked. L.A. traffic is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton LAX in June”
Reviews.Author: SLS_CFS_APS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We stayed for two weeks and paid $109/night through Hotwire.com. At the time of booking, other comparable hotels were charging closer to $150/night. The amenities provided at the hotel meet the criteria of a 4-star hotel. There is an airport shuttle that runs 24 hours a day (there are multiple shuttles and the wait time is about 5-10 minutes). There are two restaurants in the hotel: The Brasserie serves breakfast and lunch (on the expensive side-simple breakfast will run about $12-$14, $16 for the breakfast buffet), and Shula's (steaks will run about $40). In addition, there is a Starbucks which opens at 5:30am. There is a Subway within 1 block which serves from 6:00am to 9PM. If you are renting a car, there are a number of restaurants within 2 miles. For a simple, inexpensive dining place (where the locals go), try Dinah's on Sepulveda Blvd. Tips: Free coffee is stationed at the bar in the lounge. Free TAZO tea bags can be taken at the Business Office Center on the 2nd floor. Lemonade is served at 3:30pm in the lobby. If you have a car, parking is provided by an independent company towards the back of the hotel. Cost is about $13/day. Otherwise, the hotel offers valet parking. There is air traffic noise but this can be remedied by purchasing inexpensive ear plugs before you start your trip. The primary clientele of this hotel is conferences and airline pilots/stewardesses, and probably those of us who used Hotline.com to book. There are relatively few children in the hotel. We contacted guest services twice during our stay, once for additional towels and once for A/C noise. Both issues were handled immediately. All the staff we came in contact with were very courteous, friendly, and efficient. We would definitely stay here again. Cons: No free parking No free continental breakfast No free internet Limited storage space for clothing Room noise was only occassionally a problem Air traffic noise can last through the night since this is an International Airport. If you are not turned off by any of these issues, then you'll enjoy your stay here, as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Extra Charges Were Annoying”
Reviews.Author: lilmisstex713
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March. I booked on Hotwire and got a good deal. We went to the Los Angeles area for her Spring Break. This hotel is very close to the airport which ended up being very convenient for us because our flight didnâ€™t arrive in LA until 11pm and that is 1pm Houston time. By the time we got our luggage and then picked up our rental car we didnâ€™t get to the hotel until around 1am which is 3am Houston time. I would not have wanted to be driving all over the place at 3am looking for my hotel (we passed this hotel on the way to get our rental car so I knew exactly where to go back to.) This hotel is not within walking distance of many tourist sites but no hotel is within walking distance of all the tourist sites in the LA area since they are all spread out. We went to Universal Studios, Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and the Hollywood Forever Cemetery while out there this trip and none of it was really that far. Thankfully our rental car had a GPS device in it so we never got lost. Also traffic wasnâ€™t as bad as people make it out to be. If anyone thinks LA is bad try driving in Houstonâ€¦. At least California has banned the use of hand held cell devices while driving and I really think that has helped their traffic situation. I wish Texas would do the same. The room was large enough, our A/C worked very well, there was plenty of hot water, and I didnâ€™t really hear any noise. You can hear the occasional rumble of planes taking off but its not something that bothered me. Also I didnt hear any noise from other guests. I sleep with ear plugs in so noise is a non issue for me anyway. The hotel has a heated pool and my daughter got in that one evening. It was chilly and she said the water temp was perfect. I didnâ€™t care for the fact that the hotel charges $25 a day to park your vehicle. Its valet parking and they do have self parking (for $6-$9 a day, cant remember for sure) but its located in the back of the hotel and I would not have felt safe walking alone at night with my 9 year old from where it was located at. It would have been a very dark walk. The hotel also charged per day for internet access which is annoying but most hotels with star rating charge for internet access. I think it was either $9 or $15 for a 24 hour period. There are not any restaurants around this hotel but there are some just up the road. I did not try the onsite restaurant so I have no idea how that is. Also beware when making u-turns on the road in front of the hotel. I got a ticket for making an â€œillegalâ€� u-turn there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a 12-hour layover at LAX. Worth the cost for solid sleep, use of fitness center and a shower! I slept most of the time so I didn't explore the hotel but I will say my room was huge with a king bed and a queen sleeper sofa in a sitting area around the corner. Very masculine decoration. Bathroom was kind of small for such a big room, but had great water pressure and towels were thick and soft. Fitness center opens to the pool and gets a nice breeze, and the equipment has TVs and fans for comfort. One strange thing is that the fitness center didn't have any dumbbells under 25 lbs. Hmm. Has a starbucks in the lobby, very convenient. Shuttle to airport was very prompt. Overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty extra charges”
Reviews.Author: petefrommaui
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was very satisfactory, airport pickup was perfect, room was clean, the concierge was very helpful, but there was a $10.95 surcharge for in room internet and a charge of $ 2.00 per international calling card call. The telephone charge card in the room mentioned a $ 2.00 charge for the first 60 minutes and 10 cents/minute thereafter, but did not mention the $ 2.00 per call charge. I feel that a 4 star hotel should not need to nickel and dime it's guests in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed a night - very comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: moody79
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but it was very nice. Large comfortable bed. room was a little dingy, and the view wasn't amazing 0 but then its right next to an airport so what can one expect!?

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star. A dull 3-star.”
Reviews.Author: bdt61
Reviews.Content: Location was my first instinct, the Sheraton was less than 5 miles from work for the week-end of Memorial day. This particular need was fulfilled. however a very dull 3- star would be more fitting of a rating. There was never any hot water. Granted , I enjoy a hot, hot shower. It was warm, yes but never hot. We showered early and late in the evening as well as middle afternoon, hot water temperature availability never changed : warm. The rooms were clean, on the small side for a Sheraton. Self park, a nice walk, good for the digestion, 10 to 15 mn, depending where you could find parking. There was a shuttle to lot, if you have the luxury of time. I was there on business. The keys had to be changed twice, they simply stopped working, back to the counter to be rekeyed. Personnel helpful, friendly and professional. All around from luggage to front desk and all else. No where to eat truly. we had to tackle the long dark walk to the lot for dinner. Perhaps for an away flight, this an adequate choice. A 3 -day business trip, no. Too many inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: okop
Reviews.Content: Myself and a buddy were in Palm Springs for some golfing and stayed here for one night after dropping off the rental car. Arrived and got checked in quickly. As a plat member I was upgraded to the club floor. Arrived onto the club floor and floors were dirty and just the overall feel was not very clean. Got to our room and found the colors very warm but dull ?? greys. maybe to hide the dirtiness - Although the bed sheets seemed very clean the bathroom was in dire need of upgrades and repairs. For a club room this bathroom had mold all over the shower area; shower head coming out of the wall and the shower itself was so low that you had to bend down to have a proper shower ? Checked out the club lounge for breaky......pretty lame and ended up going downstairs for breakfast. Not a vending machine in the place or anywhere for that matter to get any munchies.......I was told if I was hungry to order room service ? I just wanted a bag of chips or something. Had a few drinks in the lounge. No problems. Not a bad place but definately not a place that sticks out in my mind. As a starwood member I think the next time I am in the area I will check out the Westin down the street and see if it is any better.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't say it's quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Beautifulvocalist
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked this hotel through Hotwire and it was given a four star rating for this airport hotel. I had a four day stay in the Los Angeles area and wanted it close to the airport. Once there I was informed of the $24 a day for valet parking or self park in the back of the hotel in an airport parking lot. Which cost us roughly $13 a day to park and you had to walk a distance to get back to the hotel. I never saw the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. This was a bit of an inconvenience but nevertheless we had no choice. For the most part i had a decent experience. I was not in the hotel long enough to enjoy any of the amenities. Check in went smoothly and the concierge was helpful. As far as the rooms go I was not really impressed (1063). It was a bit small.. outdated televisions, bathroom needs attention. It was small and, they seem to have problems with the tubs not being clean enough and chipping paint. Otherwise it was and okay experience and I would visit again, but I wouldn't say it is quite a 4 star hotel, maybe 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice 4-star airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mojave
Reviews.Content: We found a nice, clean and well-appointed room, with a view on the runway, and excellent soundproofing. Staff were pleasant and efficient. One negative: if you plug your computer, the bill goes up $11, and I did not see any warning. WiFi is available in the lobby, free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what ii is”
Reviews.Author: TOfamily269
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to start our vacation and another on the end of our vacation. Rooms are not big but have been updated, althougth they didn't do complete job on the bathrooms. Check in was easy. Shuttle seemed to take longer to pick up on arrive, but it was at the end of a long day. We left at 5:30 am and shullte was waiting there. Pool area looked great for an airport hotel. Wouldn't suggest it for an extended stay but was good for an airport hotel. Starbucks in the lobby was handy too!

Reviews.Title: “discusting things growing in the tub”
Reviews.Author: KrmiNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception, room luxury, but discusting things growing in the tub. Nasty bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to airport, but inconsiderate”
Reviews.Author: edwardratcox
Reviews.Content: We only needed a place to sleep for an overnight layover. The location was very convenient to LAX, but finding the shuttle bus was ridiculous. After 20 minutes we hailed a cab only to discover it was just a few blocks away. When we checked in, we reiterated our request for a cot and were told it would be there in 15 minutes. An hour later, my daughter was fast asleep in our bed and we called down to cancel the cot. Not a restful sleep at all. No one even bothered to apologize for the inconvenience. One weird thing that happened was the elevators had a mind of their own. There was a guy trapped on there with me who told me he stays in this hotel a few times a year and the elevators have been flakey like that every time he does.

Reviews.Title: “Somethings growing in the bathtub”
Reviews.Author: bloughda
Reviews.Content: I was profoundly disappointed in this hotel. I booked four different hotels for my most recent stay in Los Angeles. All hotels were booked through hotwire, but this was the only 4 star. All others were 2 or 3 star. Naturally, I assumed this would be the nicest. Unfortunately, I could not have been more wrong. Although I wasn't terribly impressed with the amenities of the hotel (there was only one restaurant opened when we got there and it was the most up-scale, when we just wanted an evening snack, the gift shop was not opened at 10PM) the main problem was with the bathtub. It was completely covered in small black spots. At first I thought it was paint spattered on the bottom of the tub, but I rubbed it, and it smeared! It was the consistency of charcoal. Of course, I called the front desk and the immediate response was, "I'm sorry, we don't have any other rooms available." I insisted that housekeeping come up and clean the tub. A nice gentleman came very quickly and cleaned, then asked me to come look and approve the work. The tub was spotless. I thanked him and asked what the stuff was. His only response was, "It's nasty, isn't it?" I agreed that it was, but at least the tub was clean so I didn't say anything else. Imagine my surprise when the next morning the tub was in exactly the same condition as it had been when we arrived the night before!! The photos that accompany this review were taken in the morning, AFTER the tub had been cleaned and appeared spotless 8 hours earlier. I wish now that I would have called the Health Department and waited until they got there, but I wanted to get started on my vacation. I put a towel down and took my shower. This hotel was by far the worst of all four; the others were quite a pleasant surprise after this fiasco. The photos were taken with my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: On our way to Hawaii, leaving NYC at night, we needed a place for a few hours at LAX until we could catch the morning flight to Honolulu. For $116, this wasn't a bad option and they have a good shuttle to and from the airport being so close. When we checked in, they were friendly and even upgraded us to a small suite. Nice big room, but I cannot understand why they still had an old tv instead of a flat panel. The old tv was at an odd angle and distance from the bed and made watching in bed difficult. The only problem is that we got a room that connected next door, and at 1am, we had to call downstairs to have them call the guy to ask him to lower the tv (was watching some church sermon very loudly). Otherwise, it was great for what we used it for.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattJHB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in April 2008. Check in was fast and friendly and my room on the 9th floor was great. I was originally in another room which had a noisy aircon and I was moved as soon as I called the front desk. The rooms are tastefully decorated and are very comfortable. The beds are fantastically comfortable. Room service was quick. Breakfast the nect morning was very good. The hotel deserves it's star rating, and my only complaint is the parking - you can either valet your car at enormous expense or park at a general airport parking lot behind the hotel, which isn't cheap either. People may feel uncomfortable walking around behind the hotel alone at night. Would I stay there again? Yes. It's a great hotel witn comfortable facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Toronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway by LAX in late March/08. The hotel shuttle is excellent. Check-in was wonderful. We stayed on the club floor. The room was large and not to over-crowded with furniture. The lobby is nice and the outdoor pool is very nice. There's a free shuttle bus that takes you from the hotel to Manhattan Beach area (very nice area)...about a 20 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Above average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinner Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room (room 957) for one night on the return leg of our journey home from New Zealand to the UK. The room was spacious and very quiet though the bathroom wasn't that big. Our one supper was in the hotels Shula's 347 restaurant where the service and steaks were excellent. Breakfast the following morning was in the Brassiere Restaurant which had a good value buffet continental breakfast with lots of choice. The hotel has quite a nice pool and terrace with plenty of sun beds and armchairs. Staff throughout were very efficient and there always seemed to be plenty on duty. You could also catch a free bus nearby to take you to a shopping mall and beach at Manhattan Beach about 30 minutes away. Finally, there was a regular (every 20 minutes) shuttle to the airport which was about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peacewalker
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is right close to the airport - perfect for layovers - which is what it was for us. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the hotel itself is just really great - service, amenities, etc. There is a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby, Bliss bath products, plush towels and luxury bedding. A perfect spot for an overnight layover. The hotel shuttle was complementary and picked us up at 2am. I highly recommend this spot for layovers - not sure if the location is good for anything else but it was really great for us. I noticed a lot of conferences going on - seems like a good place for that too - esp because its so close to the airport. Booked on hotwire and paid $135. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: pete0807
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The staff in the hotel were courteous, helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and well-appointed and we cannot praise the hotel and its staff enough. A couple of staff are worthy of special mention because their contribution to our stay helped make the difference. Albert - the concierge - is worth his weight in gold if you're a tourist and don't know the area. Nikki, who works in the bar, is a shining example of what a customer-facing employee should be. Choosing the Sheraton Gateway was a trade-off fo us, as tourists. We needed somewhere close to the airport after an 11-hour flight but wanted to be fairly close to the 'touristy' places. We made the right decision and wouldn't hesitate to say there again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: RoKelly
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway is a really rare airport hotel. Very well maintained as opposed to some of the reviews I've read on Trip Advisor. Our room was pretty clean, the hotel public space was pretty clean as well. One note, it took housekeeping at least two days to notice some nut shells in a public hallway on the 3rd floor. I actually thought that wasn't bad because I notice everything (other guests probably didn't even realize the shells were there) and that was the only housekeeping concern that I had in a public space. As far as the room goes my only issue was the comforter, it had a stain on it but I never use them anyway so I just took it off the bed but wanted to wait and see if housekeeping would notice it and replace it with a clean one. They didn't so on my 2nd night there I asked that it'd be replaced and they responded very quickly to this request and any others that I had. Other areas like the hot tub needed to be cleaned as well and the elevators were very slow and probably needed to be serviced; experienced a situation where several guests including myself were stuck on the 1st floor because the doors did not shut properly, a guest had to pull the doors open to reset them. I never reported this incident. Though we had some minor issues service was great, the restaurant was great, the room ultimately was very comfortable, beautiful decor and furnishings. I would stay again and more than likely will soon. My biggest problem with the Sheraton Gateway is parking...yes we've read this before, it is a headache. First off, we did choose to park valet the first day due to schedule constraints...it was just convenient at the time. On the next two days that we had a rental we chose the Sheraton/LAX lot behind the hotel. It was very inconveniently located. My husband had to shuttle back to the hotel after parking the car!! Then, on the day we checked out I noticed we were charged for valet for 5 days instead of 1...we didn't even have a car on the last three days of our stay. I was very disappointed by that...but otherwise this hotel is still one of the best I've experienced at a Priceline rate of $90/night for it's star-rating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: 920dm66
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in March. Nice beds, modern decor with lots of black. Loved the Starbucks in the lobby.The bar - oh well... But staff always very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: Pros: Free shuttle from LAX to the hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, VERY quick room service, comfortable beds, reasonable rates. Cons: Dated bathroom (the shower head was only at my chin level!), fee for in-room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: lhook
Reviews.Content: We flew into LA late on Saturday night, so we decided to spend the night at the Sheraton to avoid drivng in the dark. We arrived at the airport, called the Sheraton, got our luggage, walked outside and the shuttle pulled up. We got checked in right away and went up to our room. The beds were awesome - we used starpoints to stay here and it was a great night's sleep. There was not a lot of noise - I use ear plugs so you may be able to hear the planes - but I did not. In the morning, we got up and I went downstairs to check email on my laptop (it's free in the lobby) - there was tons of space to sit down and plug in and starbucks is in the hotel so that was an added benefit. We left and shuttled back to airport and picked up the shuttle for thrifty and headed out to Pasadena. Great hotel near the airport - clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and modern!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Use the Four Points hotel phone number in the Arrivals area to get put through to this hotel's main desk, so that the 10 minute shuttle can pick you up. The rooms are very modern and trendy, and the view is pretty good (although you're in an industrial airport area, so what can I say). Amazingly quiet, considering that planes are flying overhead. Breakfast buffet is a bit over priced, and the selection is only OK at best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay At The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Jepockn
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. We stayed here for five night in Feb 2007. We felt the parking was a problem but then we just figured we would park on the street behind the hotel for free instead of spending the 14 dollars a day. There was usually always a spot. Anyways rooms were very clean, beds were awesome and the gym was top notch. All in all definatly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the parking”
Reviews.Author: flame01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property from Jan 26th - Jan 29th and again on the night of Feb 1st. This hotel is really nice except for a few small details, Charging guests to park their cars is a little over the top when the car park (not the valet parking) is a 5 minute walk behind the hotel...not alot you might say, but when I stayed, the car park was almost full and I had to park at the furthest point from the entrance and then had to walk in very heavy rain to get to the hotel...and I got charged about â‚¬13 per day for this privledge. Its a public car park , but Sheraton guests get a special rate...big deal!!! My room was excellent but the door lock (electronic) required attention and after I was told it was fixed, it still caused problems...like locking me out of my room each time. The hotels saving grace...the quick shuttle to the airport and the "heavenly beds"....wow, the best ever

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Mikar85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights due to location. It was ok, but not great. The room decor was modern, though it did not feel comfortable. There were many conferences going on, so the lobby was busy and noisy. And cold! The food at the bar and in the restaurant was average and a little pricey. Front desk staff not knowledgeable about local info. Parking fee was a little high, too, as was the internet fee. Convenient to LAX, but other than that, nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: OutOfOffice2008
Reviews.Content: This is a completely reasonable airport hotel. I was only in LA overnight and would have preferred to stay in town, but the rate here was way more affordable. I went expecting the usually below-par airport hotel experience but was very surprised to find a large but fresh hotel. The room was great - very clean with an up to spec. Sheraton bed. I had to sleep and was able to make the room 100% dark, but there was some airplane noise audible (granted I did ask for a good view of the southern-most runway). This is still an airport hotel, impersonal and surrounded by parking lots and other airport hotels, but it did provide a good night's sleep. I did have my Starwood Gold status recognized at check-in and was put in a "preferred floor" - but had no club access as am not a Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: Scarletangel
Reviews.Content: I had a friend from out of town that stayed at this hotel before flying out of LAX. I came down for the night to visit and stayed with her. The room was clean, and that was probably the best part of the stay. The bed was quite hard, and neither of us got much sleep. The sleep we got was also disturbed by planes taking off and landing, which, I admit; is something you have to deal with staying by the airport. We also ate at Shula 347, which was the restaurant in the hotel. The prices were reasonable, and the food was quite good. The service could have been a little more attentive; but overall it was a fine experience. Overall, it was an okay experience; nothing to rave about, but nothing super exciting either.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: livetortrvl
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel near LAX. Got a room for $89 on priceline and it was a steal at that price. We had a late international flight and had to stay overnight in LA. Couldn't have picked a better hotel. Right next to the airport. We were helped with our baggage both ways. The shuttle to the airport is frequent. Rooms were nice and clean. Room service was good although expensive like most hotels. Even though its right next to the runway, there's no airplane sound. Nice views of the runway, enjoyed watching the planes land and takeoff.

Reviews.Title: “clean and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelW3kids
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our clean room and the wonderful service. We ordered room service and my two young children (4 and 6) had plenty of delicious options on the kid's menu. (for a great price)! Also, the breakfast buffet the next morning was wonderful. They didn't even charge for the kids!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best bargains in LA”
Reviews.Author: steveindenver
Reviews.Content: Our corporate rate is 90/night for this hotel. Given the rate one might think the place is a dump. Nothing is further from the truth. The rooms are well furnished, some newer and nicer than others and the staff is excellent. One thing to note though, and this is not unique to just this Sheraton, I'd say 80 percent of the time I find urine on the toilet seat upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton LAX Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: bluecarguy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel to visit family and friends in the South Bay area. The location was very convenient for our purposes. We've stayed at Sheraton properties quite often before, and have found them to be generally good, but not usually this good. Our room, which I don't think was a special one, was quite spacious with excellent furnishings and a most comfy bed. I wasn't expecting such a large room and first cabin bed, given the price and airport location. All the staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, which was an impressively efficient operation in spite of serving a crush of customers every morning. What looked like a twenty minute line for coffee turned out to be a five minute wait at the most. Kudos to them! In spite of being an extremely busy airport hotel the elevators were prompt and speedy even early in the morning when they often bog down at most hotels. I had occasion to use the fitness center and found the cardio equipment to be very good, the weight gear is just ok. The only real gripes we could think of was a $6 charge to use the lobby computers, a bit of a silly rip-off of paying guests needing to print a boarding pass. Also, a little fridge in the room would be nice. The free shuttle to Manhattan Beach for shopping and beach stuff is a wonderful service. Several times we stopped by the hotel just to freshen up between engagements and I had expected a hassle from the staff about parking in front for a few minutes. They had no problem with it, and I very much appreciated that. For overnight parking we used the self parking lot behind the hotel. That was reasonably priced for the airport and in a handy location, although the attendants (not Sheraton people) were invariably rude and functioned at glacier speed, which is why we preferred to park in front for brief stop ins. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. All in all, a fine choice at LAX. One last recommendation: Uncle Bills in Manhattan Beach for breakfast. You will wait for a table, but it's a breakfast worth waiting for!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: powersla
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, but it was a good experience. I read some of the other reviews about the rooms needing an update, but my room was very modern and new (reminded me more of a W hotel) in the way it was decorated. I am a gold member, so maybe I got a newer, remodeled room? It was on the 12th floor. Service was professional -- not overly friendly, but they got the job done. I mostly chose this hotel because of it's location close to the airport, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise for an airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Sheraton on a late night flight from the east coast and was very surprised because I had expected far less from an airport hotel. The rooms were extremely comfortable, well-decorated, and clean. And the staff was very helpful - when I was in desparate need of a bagel and cream cheese to accompany the Starbucks coffee I had purchased in the lobby, the restaurant kindly boxed it up so that I could take it back to my room and get back to some pending work. Small details but those are the things that compel an "excellent' rating. I would absolutely stay here again - it was fantastic to arrive there in minutes from the hellish experience that is LAX. This is the second recent Sheraton stay that was a great pleasure - the chain is definitely doing something right!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: issyK
Reviews.Content: You probably won't want to stay in this area unless you need easy access to LAX, but even amongst the airport hotels this is a subpar choice. - feels more like a 3-star than 4-star property - tub was dirty - and when water was turned on, a gush of dirty brown water gushed out - felt worn and unkempt positive points: - bed is standard Sheraton, good quality sheets - large number of rooms - decent size room It's not completely disgusting, but there are other choices in the immediate area and even with the SPG group, I prefer to stay at the Westin LAX which is just down the road

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tymp
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for vacation in Oct 07. Chose to stay near the airport as we did not want to pay extras for hotels and parkings at the downtown. Paid $75 per night for Sheraton, and we thought it was reasonable. It was convenient to drive to our destinations, e.g. Universal Studio, Beverly Hills, Hollywood. We chose to self park at the back of the hotel, which cost $13.25 per night. We were quite disappointed with the dirty sheets in our room. When we informed the reception, the person was not professional in attending to us, merely acknowledging, not attempt to provide any constructive solutions/suggestions. She said new sheets will be sent in 30 mins time. We were extremely unhappy as it was 1230am and we were dead tired from our 380 miles drive from San Fran that day! When the sheets finally came in 10 mins time, the housekeeping staff just brought the sheets into our room and expected us to change it ourselves!! It's not a bad hotel at all, with its nice and modern deco and its facilities, but i think the hotel staff should be able to handle issues in a more professional manner.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a refurb about 10 years ago!!”
Reviews.Author: athtrasna
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Sheraton Gateway and it was disappointing to see that it was no closer to feeling like a 21st century hotel, to me it's still stuck in the 80s and needs upgrading soon. Check in agent was unhelpful verging on rude but at least this time we didn't get placed next to a family with energetic young children who screamed the place down at 6am! Elevators were a lottery, worked okay on arrival, didn't work when going to and from work out room and worked when we checked out. Room was a decent size, but no magnifying mirror in the bathroom and few accesible electrical sockets for those all important chargers for phones, ipods, cameras.... Wait for shuttle was about 15 mins the next morning. For $75 on Priceline it's not a bad deal but I wouldn't like to have paid too much more.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but dated”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for one night with a room booked via my Starpoints. Nice and close to LAX, fast, convenient shuttle, everything you'd really want for an airport hotel. Rooms however do feel a bit dated - if you've stayed in various Sheratons, you'll know that whilst the services are usually quite similar, the rooms can vary depending on how old the hotel is, and this was on the lower end of the scale. Both room and bathroom showing signs of wear+tear, and could use a bit of a makeover. Few lights etc not working in room, but no biggie. On a happier note, we did get upgraded to a suite (which wasn't much bigger than a room), and enjoyed a decent meal at the steakhouse on the ground floor which is pretty good. All in all, a decent airport stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Good but for the Elevators!”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway is a consistently good choice for a stay near to LAX except for one thing: the elevators. On my most recent stay, none of the guest elevators were working upon check-in. All guests (and housekeepers, room service staff, bellmen, etc.) were being routed to a single service elevator in a utility room. The waits were very long, the elevators very crowded. The elevator problem persisted off and on throughout our stay. I asked a staff member how long this had been going on and he told me there have been elevator problems for "several months". I know that any commercial establishment can suffer an elevator outage, but it concerns me that the problem here seems to be both extensive and chronic. In that this is a fifteen floor property, you may wish to call the hotel before booking to determine the current status of their elevator problems. That being said, it is worth checking on this hotel. It is very convenient to LAX. The rooms are comfortable, quiet and well appointed. The beds are exceptionally comfortable. The housekeeping is excellent. The staff is hard-working, yet pleasant. This hotel is a good way to begin, end or transit a trip. I have stayed at the Sheraton Gateway quite a few times so I feel qualified to comment on its consistency. But I am also surprised at this most recent development with its elevators and hope that hotel management will address it more seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds......ahhhhhhhhhhhh”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and neat. The view was fantastic. The price was right for a hotel like this ($110.00) per night. In fact I was surprised at the rate. The company I work for placed the reservation. The valet parking was very expensive $25 or you walk down an alley I did not like to a parking lot behind the hotel. They have air controlled air conditioning in the rooms I was not happy with because it just did not seem to cool off enough and it was very hot & humid in LA during my stay. Breakfest was hot and on time 5:45 am, I couldn't believe that because hardly ever do you get your breakfest delivered by room service like it just came off the stove. The staff was super and the overall experiance other than the air was great!

Reviews.Title: “near airport but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jollygilly
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our last night as we wanted to be near to the airport. The hotel was pricey and the room were shabby . The only good point was the security to go to the rooms, ie without a room key the lift would not work. There is a shuttle bus to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: FatherMckenzie
Reviews.Content: Very nice considering it is an airport hotel. It is very clean and comfortable. And I am particular! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was large enough for three of us to be comfortable. The beds were comfortable the furnishings were good. The bathroom was a good size and clean. Cable Internet service in the rooms was $11 per day but wireless was free in the lobby. There is a business center but they charge for Internet and printing boarding passes. The hotel was clean and luxurious. The pool was nice with comfortable lounge chairs and good service for food and drink. There was annoying music over the loud speakers though. The shuttle to and from the airport runs about every 10 minutes. The location is fine if you want to walk for exercise, not pleasant in terms of noise and traffic but safe. They offered us a 6 PM checkout for only $50, which was great because we had an 11 PM flight.

Reviews.Title: “Declining property”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: First time I reviewed this property it was pretty good. This time, I think there are better options. Desk chair does not raise and lower and had a cigarette burn. Towles were still damp on the rack. No bath soap, only facial bars. Club room had food but not set up on time. Club room also over run by kids with no one trying to control them. Self-parking has Sheraton signage but is not part of the property so you cannot bill it to the room. Paying for parking took ten minutes and four different signitures. As a Platinum I was offered no upgrade despite a very empty hotel with lots of suites available. Better than the Westin accross the street, but there are better LAX hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pacwell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for one night as I was passing through and found the hotel to be an excellent choice. I've stayed at numerous hotels at LAX and found the Sheraton be the superior hotel compared to the others next door. The room's were very clean, the staff was very friendly and the beds were very comfortable. I really enjoyed staying at the Sheraton and would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here between international flights.I wasn't expecting a great deal from an airport hotel but was pleasantly surprised. It's literally minutes from LAX, probably one of the closest hotels and with acomp shuttle bus that goes very frequently. Rooms large, quiet, clean and comfortable. The Starbucks in the lobby is a genius idea and much appreciated! Only criticism was that there was only one person on reception when we checked in which was somewhat annoying. Have more reception staff: travellers relish quick check in and out! Otherwise full points!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel; Recently Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: LouMonika
Reviews.Content: This hotel currently comes up with some of the best rates for upmarket properties in LA -- true it's next to a runway at LAX, but it was recently remodeled and the rooms are great -- for the price very very difficult to beat -- we also received complimentary club level (continental breakfast and snacks in p.m. but no complimentary drinks) upgrade for Starwood alliance membership which is free. Decor is muted grays, browns, and other earthtones -- very modern look in lobby. Sweet Sleeper Beds are pretty nice but only doubles not queens in the rooms with two beds. Request an airport view if you like to watch airplanes. Other side of the hotel may be a bit quieter but we slept fine with the runway side. Lounge off lobby is very nice as is the smallish pool which has free cabanas and teak chairs with cushions and lots of on site towels. Not hard to forget you are at airport. We found location convenient for runs up to Hollywood/Santa Monica and to other LA sites -- didn't encounter airport traffic congestion as we'd feared. Bathroom in hotel was spotless and housekeeping staff very efficient. Parking is a bit strange but for a big city relatively cheap (around $10/day but basically a block walk or more to your car which you park in the airport's remote parking entered by a back entrance across street from hotel -- might have misgivings as a single woman needing to access or leave car late at night, but it looked well lit patroled and safe so maybe not a problem -- at least again it was cheap). No attractions or restaurants within walking distance other than inside other hotels. We were very pleased with our 4 night stay and would recommend this Sheraton to others without qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: chuggins68
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night of 07/24 in room 1163. This hotel was your typical full service property. Standard Sheraton hospitality but for all that was touted on its website I felt under served. The rooms are not well insulated so you do here noise throughout the night as guests arrive and depart as is expected of an airport location. But one would think that this would have been better considered for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Penndentist09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March for a couple of days. The hotel is literally steps away from the airport. The hotel does a GREAT job with their shuttle vans...I had no problem getting to/from the airport. The hotel and the room itself are pretty nice. My room was very clean and everything was working fine. The beds were VERY comfortable! Housekeeping staff was friendly. The pool was a little cold (but then again..it was March)...the outdoor jacuzzi was nice, but had an almost unbearable chlorine smell...couldn't stay in there too long. My only real complaint about this hotel is the location! I did not opt to rent a car and was hoping that the bus/subway system would be sufficient to get me around (especially being from NY..I would think LA would be just as good with their public transport). I was thoroughly surprised to find this was not true..it's almost impossible to get downtown or to Hollywood on the buses/trains! You have to switch 2-3 times (on either bus or subway) and it took me well over an hour and a half one way. This was really disappointing and put a real damper on my trip. Additionally..no one knew which buses/trains I should take...in fact everyone gave me a baffled look when I told them I was going to use public transport! Also..there isn't that much to do. Everyone told me to avoid the downtown/city area..so I did. Hollywood can be covered in about an hour or two..and there is nothing else to do! I took the city tour and celebrity homes tour...both of which were good..nothing spectacular. Many of the celebrity homes are behind walls..so I couldn't see some of the homes. The best part of my trip was Santa Monica! The beach/pier are great and shopping area/promenade are really really nice. HIGHLY recommend checking it out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: asmythie
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable, near-luxury hotel with free shuttle service from LAX. Check in took longer than expected due to small staff and a customer at the front of the line having a complex issue. I was surprised that the front desk staff at such a large hotel was answering the phones as well. The room was nice, especially the beds. The one big disappointment given the overall quality of the hotel: the bathroom was poorly cleaned with gobs of hair leftover from the previous guest. The bar and restaurant were much more expensive than I'd expect for an airport hotel. A simple quesadilla, no drink ended up in a $15 tab. I'd expect this downtown or at a resort, but not out by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bigtings
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, great service, clean room, superior fitness facility, pool and hot tub. Found the concierge to be helpful and overall, the hotel's atmosphere is very tastefully done. having a starbucks on the premises adds to it, the rooms are soundproof and it was conveniently located near a major highway. Only drawback was getting your car from parking was time consuming.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: np2202
Reviews.Content: First for the good: the room and beds were nice. Now the rest. Parking is far away, valet parking is $22 a day, and allow a half hour to get your car in the morning. Breakfast is a ripoff, all a la carte and very expensive. I settled for a roll at the Starbucks inside the hotel and even that is very expensive, almost five bucks for a cup of coffee and a roll. No entertainment at night, not even a piano bar, just this awful techno music playing all day and night and the depressing black and white decor. Oh, and the "high speed" interenet. Almost $11 a day and I got speeds that reminded me of my old 100 baud modem, when it worked. But it usually didn't, so I called and got connected to some overseas guy who had to tweak it for me. And I had to do this every day, it never worked twice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Good”
Reviews.Author: romeopitbull
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for about a month. The room is pretty clean. Very expensive parking. Staff not very nice except for housekeeping. Pool only so, so. Restaurant - nothing special. Overall I am not very happy about my stay. The only positive is that they allow dogs in there. Would tell others to look for some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilano
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed one night at the Sheraton Gateway just a few days ago (early July), I was generally pleased with the hotel. It was much quieter than I expected, given its proximity to the airport and some of the reviews on this site. I did ask for a quiet room, but the rooms were well soundproofed anyway (with double pane windows that didn't open). I was also very happy with the air conditioning system--very quiet and adjustable to a specific half a degree. At many hotels, the a/c is too loud to sleep with it on, but not at this Sheraton; I didn't even hear it going off and on during the night to keep the temperature at what I'd set it for, and I'm a light sleeper. The bed was quite comfortable with good quality sheets, although I was surprised the blanket didn't get covered with a separate sheet, as at most nicer hotels these days. And--my pet peeve at most hotels--the bottom sheet wasn't fitted so kept moving around during the night. The pillow choice was good, including foam or feather. The staff were friendly and the room was very clean. The room didn't have a refrigerator (or mini-bar), but they sent a small frig. up with no charge. Shuttle service from the airport was great; I only had to wait a few minutes for it. The less positive aspects of this hotel: the bathroom was a little small and didn't have a wall mirror or lighted stand mirror as some hotels do, so it was a little hard to see close up in the big mirrors. My primary complaint, though, was that even in a non-smoking room, there was a vague smell of stale cigarette smoke--enough so that I had to buy some air deodorizer and also use a couple of scented candles. Of course, I really shouldn't complain about anything, since I stayed for free with points from the Starwood Preferred Guest program. But since one can get a good rate even through the hotel website, and given the airport convenience, quick shuttle, comfy bed, and hotel quietness, I'll definitely stay here again when I'm in LA. Maybe by then the Sheraton chain will do what Marriotts have done and go all non-smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed!”
Reviews.Author: pralin
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in June 2007 at this hotel and loved it. The bed is soooo comfortable! Great pillows and bedding. The room was clean and comfortable. For being near the airport, I didn't hear much air traffic. I slept quite comfortably and was never disturbed by outside noise. The lobby is beautiful and the Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient. We would definitely stay here again and we highly recommend it. You can't beat the price for the quality-it's as close to five star as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: tudazwomanMclean_Va
Reviews.Content: I could not be more pleased with the Sheraton Gateway. Booked thru Expedia, I got a $95/night rate. The bathrooms offered a full complement of lotions/gels/mouthwash as well as a full-length mirror and immaculate robe. A two-phone room, it featured a glass-topped writing desk and computer port, as well as a glass-top side table separating two generously proportioned club chairs. There were FOUR lamps in the bedroom each w/a directional light switch so that one could lower the lights and still sleep. The room was well insulated and I couldn't hear the nearby airport at all. Beds had two comforters and a blanket in addition to sheets. Colors of room a restful gray complimented with a burnt orange bed backboard with navy pinstripe bed covers and club chairs. Staff was exceptional to me and most helpful; oh, and the shuttle runs every 15 minutes -- very convenient for a hotel property 5 minutes from the airport. Giftshop also well maintained. Will DEFINITELY return!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: harleymanOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Rooms ok, but air con not working, some of the staff could not have been more unhelpful if they had tried, especially one of the concierges. Looking down his nose at some of the guests is not an appealing trait. Hotel ok for an overnight, but not for a stay, which given the fact that it is next door to the airport might seem obvious, but the other hotels seem to have the noise under control.

Reviews.Title: “Sharaton a nice Experiance w/great room service”
Reviews.Author: syd66ney
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Sharaton. The room looked exactly like it did in the pictures. Very 'chique' - great new modern style which i really enjoyed. They got good tv channels too as I was able to find my hockey game on an obscure channel. I was in town on buiness so I returned my rental car the night before. I had the rental company bring me back to the airport, where from there I didnt have to wait more than 10 minutes for a hotel van to come pick me up for the 10 minute ride back to the hotel. Then in the morning I took the shuttle back to the airport- again, the entire thing didnt take more than 20 minutes. I had a nice view of the planes landing and taking off. I could however hear them at night which was rather distracting. I cranked the air though and that pretty much muffled the noise. I could see the pool from my room and it looked nice but I didnt go down. Since I got to the hotel so late, the only thing I could pretty much get for food was room service. I ordered a chicken ceasar salad and a french onion soup. Let me tell you, this was THE BEST room service I have ever ordered. They came promptly. Along with what I ordered, they brought me 4 pieces of warm, fresh, crusty fench bread with butter. Also a tall ice water with lemon. Deff didnt expect that and it was very nice! And the french onion soup was not a cup but a hugh bowl! I was full just eating that. Yummy ceasar dressing too. Granted my meal cost me $35 but it was well worth the service and convenience. Loved the Sharaton and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight-Not extended”
Reviews.Author: abe_perkins81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for it's main purpose, which is flying into LAX and staying one night and leaving. However, do NOT stay if you intend to stay a few days. 1.) No free continental breakfast, you pay for a real breakfast 2.) Parking is $12 per day one block away! Parking at the hotel is $24 per day! 3.) No free internet access, that is $10.95 However, look of the hotel and comfort is great. Hotel food is great but expensive. My recommendation, stay 1 night flying thru LA is okay....coming with a car whatsoever, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable airport overnighter”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gateway rather late after a long and tiring plane journey from England. Hotel looks nice from the outside and the check-in was extremely pleasant. We had been upgraded as we are Platinum members so our room was better than average. We found the room quite large and pleasant but would not rave about it, however, it is built for people staying overnight and that it accomplished to perfection. The bed was very comfortable. The downside of the room was an extremely "tiny" bathroom. The room service snack was not very good. We could have had a meal downstairs in their steak house but we arrived when it was closing so cannot review on this restaurant. Unfortunately, we had a very early start the following morning (5am) and were not able to have breakfast in their Club Lounge as it did not open until 6am. Would we stay there again, probably as it did have the advantage of only being five minutes from the airport and overall was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilimadsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a junior suite. Parking was very expensive and this hotel was right next to the airport. We did not hear any noise from planes and had a very comfortable sleep. Not a great choice if you were vacationing and would be coming back/forth ... but perfect for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KernNative
Reviews.Content: Was lured by the marketing. The website described a relaxing atmosphere with sophisticated cabanas and inviting oasis poolside. Not the feeling I got. The cocktails were pricey, I was informed that happy hour was 1/2 priced drinks... The waitress/bar charged us full price and only corrected the price after we brought it to their attention. The price of our room included 2 free cocktails, which turned into confusion with the bar. If there was free breakfast/continental breakfast, there was no information of it. The restaurant was very pricey, we left for Pizza rather than eat at the Hotel. Hotel is not kid friendly. Not a place for kids. Parking and checking in was hectic. Checking out not any better-check your bill. Small rooms in comparison. Next time we'll stay at the Embassy-one of our favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With The Sheraton Gateway”
Reviews.Author: TRosel238
Reviews.Content: With an early morning flight out of LAX, I decided to stay at the Sheraton Gateway. As soon as I walked in the door, I noticed that the hotel has an upscale feel to it. Check in went flawlessly, and the bellhop ushered us to our room. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were the same. We had an upper level room, which had a nice view of the airport. The next morning we took the hotel shuttles to the airport. The shuttles were prompt and ontime. I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler who needs to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for price and location”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: The past three or four reviews have a theme that I'm going to echo -- I was delightfully surprised by the design of the remodel. I thought I was in a Westin, not a Sheraton and I certainly didn't expect that. The only reason I was staying there was because there weren't any rooms at the hotels I usually stayed at (Westin or Sheraton downtown). The service was great. The lobby glam. The only downside (or upside) is that it's right next to the airport. The planes didn't keep me up at night but I could hear them. If there's a reason that you need to be near LAX (or on the west side of 405) this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if you can get it cheap enough”
Reviews.Author: Corpuscle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed here. I was pretty happy the first time. Like the first time, I booked through Priceline (which calls this a 4-star hotel...that's awfully generous) for $80/night. The hotel seemed pretty busy when I checked in, so I guess they figured they could give a cheapskate Priceline customer one of the handicapped rooms. I asked for a new room, but they said they had no regular rooms available...right. The quality of their handicapped rooms is just not the same as their regular rooms. In addition to the cheap features in the bathroom (the tile and curtains in the shower reminded me of my days living in the dorms), there was a stain on the curtains, a big chip in the veneer on the furniture (yup...veneer furniture), a huge nasty yellow stain on the desk chair (needless to say I didn't sit on it) and a stain on the carpet. The walls are paper thin -- I could hear phone conversations from the next room at normal volume through the wall. Nevertheless, this place is a decent deal at about $75 per night...anything more and you'll probably be severly disappointed. Total ripoff at their standard rates. Definitely not a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 36000ft
Reviews.Content: First of all this Sheraton just completed a multi-million dollar renovation and it shows. The lobby and check-in area very open and modern. Check-in was a breeze. The guest rooms feature the new Sheraton beds, excellent work area and a very nice large chair by the window. I used the fitness center and I must say it is one of the best, each machine has its own flat-screen tv and everyone gets their own pair of headphones. It overlooks the outdoor pool area which has poolside cabanas, palm trees, and in the evening poolside cocktail service. There is a full-service Starbucks just off the lobby and its a little oasis from the busy lobby. The airport shuttle is very frequent and depending on which terminal you can even walk. By far the best part of this hotel is the fact that you do not feel like you are right next to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but expected more from Sheraton. Would stay for same price.”
Reviews.Author: Value_Al
Reviews.Content: Got a hotel for about $119 through my employer's travel agent. (Rooms on web travel sites list $195). Picked this hotel because of location (meeting across the street) and the price I paid. Room was nice, but I expected more from a Sheraton and especially if I would have paid full price. Perhaps they give the nicer rooms to those who pay full price. Never understand why these hotels nickel and dime you for internet access. It is extra. Good choice for a hotel across from LAX. Free shuttle to the airport and a free shuttle to the $12 night parking (a bit of a walk if you don't want to wait for the shuttle. NOTE: There are spaces reserved on near the entrance for the Sheraton, but I did not see them until I had already parked and carried my 2 bags about 100 ft.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay before leaving”
Reviews.Author: da_kaz
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal via Hotwire. Very clean and modern hotel and room. Unloaded the family and luggage in the loading zone before returning my van to Enterprise and getting dropped off back at the hotel. I didn't want the hassle of returning our vehicle or pay for guest parking. We just ate the food we bought from a take-out restaurant in LA and slept in our room, then rushed out. I checked out by phone later. The room was quiet and of decent size. I would have liked more than the 10-15 or so TV channels, though. A small refrigerator would have been helpful too. We would have bought coffee at the downstair Starbucks if we had time. The close location to the airport and shuttle every 10 minutes was very comforting for a quick departure for a morning flight. My wife was right: if we had stayed where we were previously in Orange County, we would've ran into problems getting ready for and catching our flight. I'd definitely stay there again for an overnighter, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at LAX”
Reviews.Author: TravelerS7
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel on their website for a business trip. Triple AAA rate was $119, which certainly seemed a better deal than something like Priceline, given that I was guarenteed a no-smoking room. Shuttle from terminal to the hotel came quickly, and got us to the hotel quickly. Four of us booked separate rooms for the same meeting and we were all pleased. I asked for a quiet room when I booked, and when I checked in they noted my request and put me in an end room that was indeed very quiet. Check in was very pleasant. The room was large (though bathroom was small to average in size), with nice, soothing colors and furnishings. Very comfortable King bed with lots of pillows. The room was very clean. One minor rawback: there was high speed internet, but apparently not wireless (at least, I couldn't get my wireless to work but didn't try calling the desk to ask about it, since I was only there one night.) Only one of us had a car; she used the valet which she said was only slightly more than the park yourself option. Had dinner in Shula's, and recommend it, even for those not staying at the hotel. I would definitely stay again at the Triple AAA rate. One of the nicer options I've tried near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel by LAX”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: When flying out of LAX anytime before noon I always try and make it down the night before so I can have a decent night's sleep and avoid having to deal with traffic in addition to getting to the airport on time. I stayed at this hotel about a month prior and they were still doing lots of renovations. This time, all renovations on the floor I was on were finished and very nice. I was given a complimentary upgrade upon check-in because the room type I reserved was full. The service was quick and pleasant and my room was nice. I enjoyed the fact that the air conditioning system actually got down to 65 degrees (most hotels only get down to 70 or 72 no matter what you've set it at). I also enjoyed the steak at their restaurant and drinks at the bar. My one complaint was the lazy service at the bar. They have outdoor tables set up but the cocktail waiters only come out to see if you're doing okay once every 2 hours it seemed. Had they bothered to check on us more frequently we'd have spent more money and ordered more drinks. Bed was comfortable, slept great - and the hotel shuttle the next morning was nice. The shuttle driver, however, has a chip on his shoulder and I get the feeling he thinks the world owes him something and he hates his job. So he wasn't so happy to assist. But other than that, I'd say this is the ONLY nice place to stay at LAX. The only other place I've tried was the Raddisson which wasn't half as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled me twice!!”
Reviews.Author: gridskipper
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel, I resolved not to do so again. As luck would have it, we were paired up again on Priceline. Not much has changed since my last stay. Still a very dark, modern-looking hotel with terrible soundproofing. The parking situation seems to have improved, perhaps because the lot was less crowded so I didn't have to walk as far. I knew not to get room service this time. That said, I had a much worse experience than before. Why? They had no non-smoking rooms except on the "club" floor! I tried a smoking room once and the stench was awful. So I paid an extra $30 a night to stay on the top floor. The room was exactly the same. And although the woman at the desk was raving about the free breakfast, it was basically muffins and toast with some weak coffee. Next time I will bid an extra $30 in a different area to try to avoid the Sheraton, or just forget about Priceline altogether. How this place gets four stars is still beyond me!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Helonskiis
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 4star, 2 rooms overnight, near LAX, for my husband & I, and my father and his companion, (in their 80's). Priceline doesn't guarantee they type of room; I know that. You request the type of room at the time of booking, and I requested non-smoking rooms at the time. A few days before our stay, I followed up with a phone call to the hotel to reconfirm that non-smoking rooms were requested. 'Gretchen' in reservations confimed this, and she did ensure our rooms were linked in the system (ie: across the hall) At no time was there any indication that we should be prepared for shoddy, worn out smelly rooms on the smoking floor (4th). . Or that renovations were ongoing in the hallway outside our rooms. Had I known in advance I could have made the decision to arrange another hotel and forfeited rooms at the Sheraton. At check-in, the front desk clerk also failed to mention that were were going to the smoking floor, until she handed me the key cards and I asked her that the rooms would be smoke-free. She appeared not to care less as she condescendingly stated "well .. you know you are [just] a Priceline customer" (Interestingly I did pay a little more than the AAA rate customers a couple of postings back). My father's companion wanted to take a bath, but when she looked in the tub, there was hard plaster stuck on the bottom of it. The venting in their room only had cold air, and when the fan came on dust and hairballs blew from the grate like a string of Tibetan prayer flags. There were dirty dishes from some previous occupant outside their room for our entire stay. The thin old blue houndstooth check carpet was full of bits of wallpaper and glue that clogged the wheels of my suitcase as I negotiated my way around workmen's pails and equipment on our way to the elevator in the morning. We did have dinner in the restaurant and it was very good. Besides, the atmosphere was a welcome relief from our rooms. This stay wasn't just disappointing, it was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Hotel: Very un-Sheraton looking. Sleek & Modern on the inside. Doormen did not offer to help with the bags but I guess we looked like we did not need assistance. They were pleasant though. The front desk was very helpful at check in and check out. Nice pool area with whirlpool (had leaves in it) as well. There was a bar and 2 restaurants (1 AM and 1 PM) and a Starbucks. Shuttle to the airport very early in the morning was spot on. Room: Very nice. Horrible noise from the air con that the maintenance man fixed straight away. Comfy bed. TV had some sound issues. I could not get the broadband to work but that was my computers fault. Good size desk. Very little outside noise noticed. USA Today at the door in the morning. Adequate bathroom facilites and good towels. This is a good choice if you need a hotel at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a layover”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: A very clean comfortable hotel, ideal for an airport layover. No noise from aircraft or roadway. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cre8tive921
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Priceline.com at a resonable rate and I was blown away buy the customer service and pleasant atmosphere. The staff makes you feel welcomed. The rooms are very neat and clean. Maid service is very excellent. I would definetly stay again. It's right near the airport. The only downfall is parking... But other than that its very nice to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: demaagddb
Reviews.Content: My husband I spent one night at this hotel and choose it for it's location near LAX. We arrived at about 9:30 PM and check-in took forever, even though there were just a few people in line. We had booked a club floor room, knowing that breakfast was offered on the floor beginning at 6AM. Our flight was due to leave at 8:55 AM and we had to return a rental car first. Upon taking the elevator up to the club floor, two other guests were complaining that their card to get to that floor hadn't worked the whole time they were there. My card worked on the elevator but not when I tried to get in my room!! I had to find a phone, call the front desk and then wait, and wait, and wait for a security guard to come and unlock the door. I ended up sitting on the floor next to the door for what seemed like forever (especially when you are tired!). The room itself was just okay. The bathroom was small. Not what I expected for a club floor room. Upon waking and hurrying to get some breakfast before our flight, we found the door locked and no sign of breakfast! (Breakfast was listed as being offered from 6AM to 9AM everyday on the club floor). We called the front desk at 6:10AM and were told that it was coming. Finally, at about 6:30AM, they opened the room and began to serve breakfast. We had to just grab a few things and go! Not the relaxing breakfast that we had planned on! Also, parking was a pain. The ramp for self-park was several blocks away and almost as expensive as valet.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelerpdx
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent an evening at the Sheraton Gateway before a next day flight to New Zealand. Customer service by everyone from the front desk to the hotel restaurant was friendly and efficient. The continuous airport shuttle was frequent and reliable. Our room was spacious (though the bathroom was comparatively small) with modern furnishings, very comfortable bed, and an entertaining view of the LAX runways.
